analyzed: 'gro ba zhes pa ni de bzhin du 'gro ba'i gzugs dang reg bya la sogs pa yang ngo // dmigs med ces pa ni /
translated: The world means the forms, tactile objects, and so on of the world.

original: don dam par na gnyis su med pas kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: don dam par na gnyis su med pas kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: Without reference means that ultimately, because of nonduality, there is no reference.

original: kun rdzob sgyu ma lta bur rab tu bshad //
analyzed: kun rdzob sgyu ma lta bur rab tu bshad //
translated: It is taught that the conventional is like an illusion.

original: ces pa ni rgyu de'i phyir tha snyad du sgyu ma'i lus ltar 'gro ba rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
analyzed: ces pa ni rgyu de'i phyir tha snyad du sgyu ma'i lus ltar 'gro ba rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
translated: For that reason, means that conventionally, the Lord has taught the world to be like an illusory body.

original: don dam par na bstan par bya ba dang / ston par byed pa dang / ston pa rnams dngos po med pa yin par dgongs so //üîΩde nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: don dam par na bstan par bya ba dang / ston par byed pa dang / ston pa rnams dngos po med pa yin par dgongs so // de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: But ultimately, he intends that the object of teaching, the teacher, and the teaching are all unreal.

original: dbang po gang dang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po gang dang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, Whatever sense faculty... and so on.

original: gang dang gang zhes pa ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang zhes pa ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'o //
translated: Whatever means forms, sounds, and so on.

original: dbang po'i lam du 'gyur zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i yul de'i rang bzhin ni don dam par gyur pa nyid do //üîΩmnyam par ma bzhag spyod pa'o//
analyzed: dbang po'i lam du 'gyur zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i yul de'i rang bzhin ni don dam par gyur pa nyid do // mnyam par ma bzhag spyod pa'o//
translated: The path of the senses is the nature of the objects of the senses such as the eye, which is the ultimate.

original: @22a * // zhes pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems so //
analyzed: @22a * // zhes pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems so //
translated: The conduct of the non-equipoised is the mind that is not in equipoise.

original: sangs rgyas kun bdag ces pa ni sgyu ma'i lus kyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun bdag ces pa ni sgyu ma'i lus kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The nature of all buddhas is the nature of the illusory body.

original: kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: All, etc. is easy to understand.

original: rnal 'byor chen po zhes pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po zhes pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'o //
translated: The great yoga is the great yoga.

original: sna tshogs ye shes rjes su sdud //
analyzed: sna tshogs ye shes rjes su sdud //
translated: It includes the wisdom of variety.

original: ces pa ni 'gro ba'i bdag nyid de ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi lus su bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces pa ni 'gro ba'i bdag nyid de ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi lus su bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of beings is included in the body that is the nature of wisdom.

original: phyag rgya thams cad ni bud med thams cad do //
analyzed: phyag rgya thams cad ni bud med thams cad do //
translated: All seals are all women.

original: smig rgyu rmi lam lta bu dang // zhes pa ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'i ngo bo ni smig rgyu dang rmi lam dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: smig rgyu rmi lam lta bu dang // zhes pa ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'i ngo bo ni smig rgyu dang rmi lam dang mtshungs so //
translated: Like a mirage, a dream, etc. is the nature of the body that is the nature of wisdom, which is like a mirage and a dream.

original: dri za'i grong khyer dag dang mtshungs //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer dag dang mtshungs //
translated: Like the cities of the gandharvas.

original: zhes pa ni sngar gyi bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngar gyi bzhin no //
translated: This is as before.

original: de dag sgyu ma'i rnam rgyal sman //
analyzed: de dag sgyu ma'i rnam rgyal sman //
translated: They are the medicine for the conquest of illusion.

original: zhes pa ni nad de la sgyu ma lta bu'i sman gyis sman pas rgyal zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nad de la sgyu ma lta bu'i sman gyis sman pas rgyal zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the doctor, with the medicine of illusion, conquers that disease.

original: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i man ngag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i man ngag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The instruction called the Self Consecration, etc. is easy to understand.

original: rnam par mkhas pa ni rnam par dpyod pa'i rgyud gcig la bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mkhas pa ni rnam par dpyod pa'i rgyud gcig la bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: Skillful means is the perfection of thought in a single analytic continuum.

original: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of the Self Consecration.

original: sgyu ma'i lus la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i lus la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: Having previously focused on the illusory body,

original: 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa yin pas na //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa yin pas na //
translated: one enters into clear light.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba gsungs pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he states the homage to the Bhagavat:

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Homage to Vajrasattva, etc.

original: thams cad stong nyid ston pa'i zhes pa ni thams cad stong pa 'od gsal ba ston par byed pas na thams cad stong pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad stong nyid ston pa'i zhes pa ni thams cad stong pa 'od gsal ba ston par byed pas na thams cad stong pa ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching of emptiness of everything is the teaching of the clear light of the emptiness of everything, so it is the teaching of the emptiness of everything.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim zhes pa ni /
translated: The stage of manifest enlightenment is the emptiness of manifest enlightenment.

original: rnam pa thams cad yang dag par mngon sum du rtogs pas na mngon par byang chub pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yang dag par mngon sum du rtogs pas na mngon par byang chub pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is manifest enlightenment because it is the direct realization of all aspects, and it is emptiness because it is the emptiness of that.

original: de rtogs par byed pa'i rim pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs par byed pa'i rim pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The stage that causes the realization of that is the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: snang ba dag ni bskyed par bya //
analyzed: snang ba dag ni bskyed par bya //
translated: One should generate the pure appearances.

original: zhes pa ni ye shes gsum gyi ngo bo dga' ba gsum ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni ye shes gsum gyi ngo bo dga' ba gsum ste /
translated: The three joys are the nature of the three exalted wisdoms.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa las gsungs pa'i /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa las gsungs pa'i /
translated: This is stated in the stage of the pure mind, which says:

original: 'dod chags nyid dang chags bral dang // gnyi ga'i bar dang gsum yin te //üîΩzhes pas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags nyid dang chags bral dang // gnyi ga'i bar dang gsum yin te //üîΩzhes pas so //
translated: Desire itself, freedom from desire, and the middle between the two are the three.

original: ka la sha sogs dag tu gzhag / byang chub sems ni zhes pa ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i don du byang chub kyi sems son pa'i thod pa la sogs pa bum pa'i steng du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: ka la sha sogs dag tu gzhag / byang chub sems ni zhes pa ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i don du byang chub kyi sems son pa'i thod pa la sogs pa bum pa'i steng du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The awakened mind is the skull-cup, etc. filled with the bodhicitta, which should be placed on the vase for the purpose of the secret empowerment.

original: brtse bas nam phyed dus dbang bskur //
analyzed: brtse bas nam phyed dus dbang bskur //
translated: One should give the empowerment with affection at midnight.

original: zhes pa @22b ni nam gyi cha stong nas brtsams te chu tshod bdun yan chod du phreng ba dang chu la sogs pas dbang bskur sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa @22b ni nam gyi cha stong nas brtsams te chu tshod bdun yan chod du phreng ba dang chu la sogs pas dbang bskur sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Beginning from the middle of the night, one should give the empowerment with the rosary, water, etc. for seven hours.

original: nam phyed na gsang ba shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba dag sbyin par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nam phyed na gsang ba shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba dag sbyin par bya ba'i don to //
translated: At midnight means that one should give the secret empowerment of the wisdom consort at midnight.

original: tho rangs kyi ni dus su yang /
analyzed: tho rangs kyi ni dus su yang /
translated: And at dawn,

original: zhes pa ni nam gyi lhag ma'o //üîΩphung po rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nam gyi lhag ma'o // phung po rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: at dawn means the remainder of the night.üîΩ The aggregates are the five aspects from form up to consciousness.

original: khams rnams zhes pa ni /
analyzed: khams rnams zhes pa ni /
translated: The constituents are the six constituents beginning with earth.

original: mig gi sgo la sogs pa chos kyi dbyings la thug pa'i bco brgyad po rnams la'o //
analyzed: mig gi sgo la sogs pa chos kyi dbyings la thug pa'i bco brgyad po rnams la'o //
translated: In the eighteen [realms] from the eye sense-sphere up to the sphere of the dharmas.

original: skye mched rnams zhes pa ni mig gi skye mched la sogs pa nas chos kyi skye mched la thug pa bcu gnyis po rnams so //
analyzed: skye mched rnams zhes pa ni mig gi skye mched la sogs pa nas chos kyi skye mched la thug pa bcu gnyis po rnams so //
translated: The sense-fields are the twelve from the eye sense-field up to the sphere of the dharmas.

original: de nas rim pa 'di nyid brtsam //
analyzed: de nas rim pa 'di nyid brtsam //
translated: Then, one should begin this very process.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas so //
translated: This process is as will be explained below.

original: rim pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The process is the process of manifest enlightenment.

original: brtsam par bya zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: brtsam par bya zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: One should begin, the rest.

original: thog med 'byung dang zhes pa ni //
analyzed: thog med 'byung dang zhes pa ni //
translated: Without beginning, arising,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di rnams su gnas pa nyid las zhes pa'i lung gis thog ma med pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di rnams su gnas pa nyid las zhes pa'i lung gis thog ma med pa'o //
translated: This is the reality of phenomena, just abiding.

original: yang na thog mar 'byung ba zhes pa ni thams cad du khyab pa'i phyir na de ni thog ma'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yang na thog mar 'byung ba zhes pa ni thams cad du khyab pa'i phyir na de ni thog ma'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Or, arising in the beginning, because it pervades everything, it is the nature of the beginning.

original: de bzhin du dbus su byung ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams la go bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbus su byung ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams la go bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should understand the words arising in the middle, etc.

original: yang na thog med 'byung ba dang // zhes pa ni sgyu lus las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na thog med 'byung ba dang // zhes pa ni sgyu lus las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is other than the illusory body.

original: thog mar 'byung ba ni sgra zung 'jug las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog mar 'byung ba ni sgra zung 'jug las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first arising is other than the union of sound.üîΩIt is not the middle arising,

original: dbus min 'byung ba'am zhes pa ni sgyu lus las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbus min 'byung ba'am zhes pa ni sgyu lus las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is other than the illusory body.üîΩIt is the endless arising,

original: mtha' med 'byung zhes pa ni zung 'jug las sngar yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' med 'byung zhes pa ni zung 'jug las sngar yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is prior to the union.üîΩThe final arising is

original: mthar ni 'byung ba rnams zhes pa ni sgyu lus las de phyis 'byung ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: mthar ni 'byung ba rnams zhes pa ni sgyu lus las de phyis 'byung ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: because it arises after the illusory body.

original: gong du 'gro ba dang ni 'ong med cing //
analyzed: gong du 'gro ba dang ni 'ong med cing //
translated: It does not go and come,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: and so forth.

original: dang po gdod ma nas ma skyes pa 'di la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa rnams mi srid pa yin par dngos so //
analyzed: dang po gdod ma nas ma skyes pa 'di la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa rnams mi srid pa yin par dngos so //
translated: This is the explicit teaching that it is impossible to posit going and coming, and so forth, for this primordial, originally unborn reality.üîΩIt is a most wondrous form,

original: shin tu ngo mtshar gzugs can zhes pa ni de ltar rang bzhin yang chos kyi sku yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu ngo mtshar gzugs can zhes pa ni de ltar rang bzhin yang chos kyi sku yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in this way, its nature is the dharmakƒÅya.

original: ngo mtshar min zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ngo mtshar min zhes pa ni /
translated: It is not wondrous,üîΩbecause

original: dngos po'i nus pa sna tshogs pas //
analyzed: dngos po'i nus pa sna tshogs pas //
translated: By the various powers of things.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshul gyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshul gyis so //
translated: This is the way.

original: rgyu dang mi rgyu'i bdag nyid ni stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang mi rgyu'i bdag nyid ni stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the animate and inanimate is the nature of emptiness.üîΩThe sole friend of the world.

original: 'gro ba'i gnyen gcig ces pa ni snying rje'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir @23a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gnyen gcig ces pa ni snying rje'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir @23a * //
translated: This is the nature of compassion.üîΩHe is also the body of the benefactor.

original: ro ; / de ni yon bo'i lus kyang zhes pa ni stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i mthus spong ba'o //
analyzed: ro ; / de ni yon bo'i lus kyang zhes pa ni stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i mthus spong ba'o //
translated: This is the abandonment by the power of realizing emptiness.üîΩHe is honest.

original: drang po yin zhes pa ni snying rjes bskul ba yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: drang po yin zhes pa ni snying rjes bskul ba yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'o //
translated: This is the engagement in the welfare of sentient beings, because he is urged on by compassion.üîΩHe has no abode on the seat.

original: stan la gnas med ces pa ni gnas med par 'khyams te yul so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir gnas so sor nges pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: stan la gnas med ces pa ni gnas med par 'khyams te yul so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir gnas so sor nges pa med pa yin no //
translated: This is the absence of a specific abode, because he wanders without a home and has no specific country.üîΩThe wise one does not bind himself to any seat.

original: mkhas pas gang zhig tu yang stan la bcings te gnas pa ni so sor nges pa bstan to //
analyzed: mkhas pas gang zhig tu yang stan la bcings te gnas pa ni so sor nges pa bstan to //
translated: This is the teaching of a specific abode.üîΩHe is even happy with his eyes closed.

original: de ni mig btsums gyur kyang zhes pa ni stong pa nyid nyams su myong bas bde ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mig btsums gyur kyang zhes pa ni stong pa nyid nyams su myong bas bde ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he experiences bliss through the experience of emptiness.

original: rnam rgyal min zhes pa ni dga' ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rnam rgyal min zhes pa ni dga' ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot victorious‚Äù refers to a special kind of joy.

original: mnyam gzhag ces pa ni stong pa nyid tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam gzhag ces pa ni stong pa nyid tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúequipoise‚Äù refers to the fact that the bodhisattva focuses on mere emptiness.

original: mnyam ma bzhag ces pa ni dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam ma bzhag ces pa ni dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnonequipoise‚Äù refers to the fact that all things are of the nature of emptiness.

original: brjod bral gsum ni stong pa nyid tsam gyi mthar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod bral gsum ni stong pa nyid tsam gyi mthar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three phrases that begin with ‚Äúfree from expression‚Äù refer to the fact that the bodhisattva has gone beyond mere emptiness.

original: tshig dang ldan ni sems can gyi don byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig dang ldan ni sems can gyi don byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúendowed with words‚Äù refers to the fact that the bodhisattva engages in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: longs spyod ldan ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi nor rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod ldan ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi nor rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúendowed with wealth‚Äù refers to the fact that the bodhisattva has acquired the wealth of all perfections.

original: gzugs bral 'gyur zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs bral 'gyur zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfree from form‚Äù refers to the fact that

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad la mi phyogs par de dang mi mthun par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad la mi phyogs par de dang mi mthun par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the bodhisattva engages in the opposite of the eight worldly concerns.

original: 'jig rten mgon ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúprotector of the world‚Äù refers to the fact that the bodhisattva realizes the body of the buddhas.

original: gzhan bran 'gyur ni rnam pa thams cad du dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan bran 'gyur ni rnam pa thams cad du dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecoming a servant of others‚Äù refers to the fact that the bodhisattva is devoid of all things.

original: rgyu ba dang ni mi rgyu nyid //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang ni mi rgyu nyid //
translated: and the moving and unmoving.

original: dngos po 'od gsal bar byas te //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po 'od gsal bar byas te // zhes pa ni /
translated: Having made things clear,üîΩThis is the meaning of the verse beginning with ‚ÄúThe mirror of the realization of form.‚ÄùüîΩBy this method, the gods of the nature of the moving and unmoving are included in one‚Äôs own body, just as they are situated.üîΩThe one arisen from the vow is the nature of the ascertained stainless.üîΩThe three who sometimes do the work of sentient beings are also stated:

original: gzugs su rtogs pa'i me long dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dis na brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi lha rnams ni rang gi lus la gnas ji lta ba bzhin du khongs su bsdu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs su rtogs pa'i me long dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dis na brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi lha rnams ni rang gi lus la gnas ji lta ba bzhin du khongs su bsdu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, etc.

original: khas kus btab pa las byung ba ni dri ma med par nges pa'i ngo bo yin pa la de ltar goms par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: khas kus btab pa las byung ba ni dri ma med par nges pa'i ngo bo yin pa la de ltar goms par bya ba nyid do //
translated: The one arisen from the vow is the nature of the ascertained stainless.üîΩThe three who sometimes do the work of sentient beings are also stated:

original: res 'ga' sems can gyi don byed pa gsum yang yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: res 'ga' sems can gyi don byed pa gsum yang yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, etc.üîΩThe one arisen from the vow is the nature of the ascertained stainless.üîΩThe three who sometimes do the work of sentient beings are also stated:

original: sems can don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, etc.

original: de dang de 'dra'i 'od zer gyis //
analyzed: de dang de 'dra'i 'od zer gyis //
translated: The one arisen from the vow is the nature of the ascertained stainless.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba 'byung bar bshad //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba 'byung bar bshad //

analyzed: chos bdag med dang mnyam med pa //

original: rang sems gdod nas ma skyes pa //
analyzed: rang sems gdod nas ma skyes pa //

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid //

analyzed: ces pa ni ji ltar sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir /

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa /

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //

original: 'bras bu ni 'od gsal lo //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni 'od gsal lo //

original: rgyu ni yongs su ma dag pa'i sgyu ma'i lus so //
analyzed: rgyu ni yongs su ma dag pa'i sgyu ma'i lus so //

analyzed: de bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i sgra'i tshig go //

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /

original: bdag byin brlab pa'i rim gyis ni //
analyzed: bdag byin brlab pa'i rim gyis ni //

original: 'od gsal ba ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni thob par 'gyur //

original: zung 'jug rim pa bla med pa //
analyzed: zung 'jug rim pa bla med pa //

original: du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //

analyzed: ldog pa mya ngan las 'das pa 'od gsal don dam pa'i bden pa'o //

original: rtog pa gnyis po spangs pas ni //
analyzed: rtog pa gnyis po spangs pas ni //
translated: By abandoning the two concepts, the state of union is attained, which is the union of samsara and nirvana.

analyzed: 'di'i rjes thogs su bstan pa'i rtog pa gnyis po spangs shing bcom zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: gang du dngos po gcig 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang du dngos po gcig 'gyur ba //

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par byang //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par byang //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ni sngar gyi bzhin du yongs su ma dag pa'i sgyu ma'i lus so //

analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni 'od gsal te tha dad pa med par rtogs pa'o //

original: don dam nyid du gcig tu 'gyur //

analyzed: gzung ba dang ni 'dzin pa zhes pa ni gzung ba ni 'od gsal lo //

analyzed: rtag dang chad pa'i blo dag ni //

original: chad pa ni 'od gsal lo //
analyzed: chad pa ni 'od gsal lo //

original: shes rab snying rje gcig par ni //
analyzed: shes rab snying rje gcig par ni //

original: zhes pa ni shes rab ni 'od gsal lo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes rab ni 'od gsal lo //

original: snying rje ni sgyu lus so //
analyzed: snying rje ni sgyu lus so //
translated: Compassion is the illusory body.

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //

original: zhes pa ni shes rab ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes rab ni stong pa nyid do //

original: thabs ni sgyu lus so //
analyzed: thabs ni sgyu lus so //

analyzed: gang du lhag mar bcas pa dang // de bzhin lhag ma med pa zhes pa ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa ni sgyu lus so //

analyzed: gang du gang zag bdag med cing //

analyzed: gnyid log pa dang sad pa dang // gnas skabs de nyid spangs pa ni //

analyzed: dran pa ni sgyu lus so //

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni //

original: zhes pa ni 'bras bu ni 'od gsal lo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'bras bu ni 'od gsal lo //

original: rgyu ni sgyu lus so //
analyzed: rgyu ni sgyu lus so //

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa 'di gcig yin //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa 'di gcig yin //

original: gzhan yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni //

analyzed: zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa ni sgyu lus so //

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni 'od gsal lo //

original: gzugs med ni 'od gsal lo //

analyzed: ces pa ni 'dir bya'o zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //

analyzed: thams cad gnyis su med pa'i nga rgyal gyis spyod pa bya ba bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /

analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste go ste go sla'o //

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //

analyzed: rim pa lnga dang 'dir yang rnam dag rim pa 'di ni ches shin tu //
translated: The five stages and this stage of purity are extremely profound.

analyzed: zab mo'i don rnams kun la tshig ni rnam 'byed byas pa'i go sla med //

analyzed: 'jig rten rdo rje sems dpar nges gyur cig / rim pa lnga dang rnam par dag pa'i rim pa rnam par bshad pa li la badzra zhabs kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /

original: rim pa zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas skabs thob pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rim pa zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas skabs thob pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The so-called stages have the characteristic of attaining a state that is increasingly superior.

original: ngag gi don ni rim pa lnga ba'i tshig gi brjod par bya ba'i rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: ngag gi don ni rim pa lnga ba'i tshig gi brjod par bya ba'i rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The meaning of the text is the topics expressed by the words of the Five Stages, such as vajra repetition and so on.

original: 'dir yang rdo rje ltar mi shigs shing so dang mchu la sogs pa'i g-yo ba spangs pa rnam par rtog pa med cing rlung tsam gyis bzlas pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'o zhes pa ni ngag gi don to //
analyzed: 'dir yang rdo rje ltar mi shigs shing so dang mchu la sogs pa'i g-yo ba spangs pa rnam par rtog pa med cing rlung tsam gyis bzlas pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'o zhes pa ni ngag gi don to //
translated: Here also, vajra-like, indestructible, free from the movement of teeth, lips, etc., non-conceptual, and with mere wind, the repetition is vajra repetition. This is the meaning of the words.

original: sems kyi rnam par dag pa ni sems rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam par dag pa ni sems rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Mental purity is mind-purity.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum dang rang bzhin gyi tshogs yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par dag pa'i ngag gi don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum dang rang bzhin gyi tshogs yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par dag pa'i ngag gi don to //
translated: The three consciousnesses and the pure group of natures is the meaning of the words mind-purity.

original: bdag gi ste 'dod pa'i lha'i rnam par sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis de'i rang bzhin du bya zhing byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya ba ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi ste 'dod pa'i lha'i rnam par sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis de'i rang bzhin du bya zhing byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya ba ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: My, i.e., the nature of the desired deity, is to be made and blessed as illusion-like concentration. This is the meaning of the words self-blessing.

original: yang na rang las te chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba las rnam par spro zhing byin gyis brlab pa ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rang las te chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba las rnam par spro zhing byin gyis brlab pa ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, from oneself, i.e., from the nature of the clear light of all things, the radiation and blessing is called self-blessing.

original: lnga pa de'i skyes bu'i tshig bsdu ba byas nas bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i ngag gi don to //
analyzed: lnga pa de'i skyes bu'i tshig bsdu ba byas nas bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i ngag gi don to //
translated: The fifth is the personification of the term, the meaning of the words of the stage of self-consecration.

original: mngon du phyogs par te /
analyzed: mngon du phyogs par te /
translated: Facing,

original: mngon sum du thob par bya ba'i byang chub de kho na nyid bzhi pa gang las thob pa de ni mngon par byang chub pa'o //üîΩyang na mngon du ste dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa las dus phyis bla ma'i man ngag las thob par bya ba'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du thob par bya ba'i byang chub de kho na nyid bzhi pa gang las thob pa de ni mngon par byang chub pa'o // yang na mngon du ste dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa las dus phyis bla ma'i man ngag las thob par bya ba'i byang chub ste /
translated: means that the enlightenment which is to be attained in actuality is the fourth reality, and that from which it is attained is manifest enlightenment.

original: gang las dpe las byung pa'i lhan cig skyes pa thob pa de ni mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang las dpe las byung pa'i lhan cig skyes pa thob pa de ni mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, facing means that the enlightenment which is to be attained later from the guru's instructions is the innate joy that is the example, and that from which the innate joy that is the example is attained is manifest enlightenment.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i ngag gi don to //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i ngag gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words of manifest enlightenment.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi zung ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi zung ste /
translated: The union of the two, the conventional and the ultimate, etc.,

original: gnyis tha mi dad par 'jug pa ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ste /üîΩzung @27a * //
analyzed: gnyis tha mi dad par 'jug pa ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ste / zung @27a * //
translated: is called the union, the non-differentiation of the two.

original: du 'jug pa rim pa'i ngag gi don to //
analyzed: du 'jug pa rim pa'i ngag gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words of the stage of the union.

original: ngag ces bya ba ni ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / nges tshig dang ldan 'dres bcas dang // rgyan bcas yid du 'ong ba yi //
analyzed: ngag ces bya ba ni ji lta bu zhe na / smras pa / nges tshig dang ldan 'dres bcas dang // rgyan bcas yid du 'ong ba yi //
translated: It is said:üîΩThat which is composed of syllables,üîΩmixed with ornaments,

original: tshig gi tshogs kyis brtsams pa gang //
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs kyis brtsams pa gang //
translated: and pleasing to the mind,

original: dag ces bya bar brjod par bya //
analyzed: dag ces bya bar brjod par bya //
translated: is called speech.

original: brda sprod pa dag ni bya ba'i tshig gcig dang ldan pa'i tshig gi tshogs ni ngag yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: brda sprod pa dag ni bya ba'i tshig gcig dang ldan pa'i tshig gi tshogs ni ngag yin no zhes zer te /
translated: The grammarians say that speech is a collection of words having a single verbal action.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi ngag gi don gang yin pa de ni ngag gi don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi ngag gi don gang yin pa de ni ngag gi don zhes bya'o //
translated: That which has such a form is the meaning of speech.

original: bsdus pa yang yin la don yang yin pas na bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsdus pa yang yin la don yang yin pas na bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: It is a collection and also a meaning, thus it is a collection-meaning.

original: de la don bcu gcig gis rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i don bsdus te /
analyzed: de la don bcu gcig gis rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i don bsdus te /
translated: In it, the meaning of vajra repetition is summarized in eleven meanings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bzlas pa dang / sku'i bzlas pa dang / gsung gi bzlas pa dang / thugs kyi bzlas pa dang / rin po che'i bzlas pa dang / don yod pa'i bzlas pa dang / khro bo'i bzlas pa dang / 'dod chags kyi bzlas pa dang /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bzlas pa dang / sku'i bzlas pa dang / gsung gi bzlas pa dang / thugs kyi bzlas pa dang / rin po che'i bzlas pa dang / don yod pa'i bzlas pa dang / khro bo'i bzlas pa dang / 'dod chags kyi bzlas pa dang /
translated: the repetition of Great Vajradhara, the repetition of Body, the repetition of Speech, the repetition of Mind, the repetition of Jewel, the repetition of Amogha, the repetition of Wrath, the repetition of Passion,

original: zhe sdang gi bzlas pa dang / gti mug gi bzlas pa dang / ma ning gi bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi bzlas pa dang / gti mug gi bzlas pa dang / ma ning gi bzlas pa ste /
translated: the repetition of Aversion, the repetition of Delusion, and the repetition of the Neuter.

original: de rnams kyang 'og nas skabs su bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang 'og nas skabs su bshad par bya'o //
translated: These will be explained in their respective contexts below.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'i don ni gsum gyis bsdus te /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'i don ni gsum gyis bsdus te /
translated: The meaning of the stage of the purification of mind is summarized in three topics.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: snang ba rnam par dag pa dang / snang ba gsal ba rnam par dag pa dang / snang ba nye bar thob pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba rnam par dag pa dang / snang ba gsal ba rnam par dag pa dang / snang ba nye bar thob pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: the purification of appearance, the purification of the appearance of clarity, and the purification of the appearance of attainment.

original: bdag byin gyis brlab pa ni gsum kho na ste /
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlab pa ni gsum kho na ste /
translated: Self-consecration is just three.

original: chos kyi sku'i bdag byin gyis brlab ba dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag byin gyis brlab pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i bdag byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i bdag byin gyis brlab ba dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag byin gyis brlab pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i bdag byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: The consecration of the body of reality, the consecration of the body of beatitude, and the consecration of the emanational body.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i don ni gsum gyis bsdus te /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i don ni gsum gyis bsdus te /
translated: The meaning of the stage of manifest enlightenment is summarized in three topics:

original: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam par dag pa dang / 'dod chags bar ma rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam par dag pa dang / 'dod chags bar ma rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: the purification of desire, the purification of freedom from desire, and the purification of the desire that is the middle.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i don ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gis bsdus te /
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i don ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gis bsdus te /
translated: The meaning of the stage of union is summarized in terms of cause and effect.

original: rgyu ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / gsang sngags kyi tshul gyis dbye ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / gsang sngags kyi tshul gyis dbye ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The cause is the four divisions of the vehicle according to the proclaimers, solitary sages, bodhisattvas, and the way of secret mantra.

original: de dag gi dbye ba mang po yang de nyid du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dbye ba mang po yang de nyid du bshad par bya'o //
translated: The many subdivisions of these are to be explained in that very (Hevajra) tantra.

original: 'bras bu yang rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba dang rdzas kyi dbye bas rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba dang rdzas kyi dbye bas rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The effect is also fourfold in terms of the divisions of family, quality, activity, and substance.

original: mdor na 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyi dbye bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mdor na 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyi dbye bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In brief, it is the division of the eight worldly dharmas.

original: rgyas par ni de nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni de nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be explained in detail in that very [Hevajra Tantra].

original: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Now this should be analyzed.

original: rim pa 'di rnams @27b kyi so so'i thabs du zhe na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rim pa 'di rnams @27b kyi so so'i thabs du zhe na brjod par bya ste /
translated: What are the individual methods of these stages?

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i thabs ni rlung gi de kho na nyid dang / sngags kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i thabs ni rlung gi de kho na nyid dang / sngags kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The method of the stage of vajra repetition is the reality of the winds and the reality of mantra.

original: de la rlung rnams kyi de kho na nyid ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin te rlung gi de kho na nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la rlung rnams kyi de kho na nyid ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin te rlung gi de kho na nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therein, the reality of the winds is the ultimate nature, which is called the reality of the winds.

original: de gang zhe na yungs kar gyi 'bru phra mo'i tshad tsam gyi thig le'i gzugs te /
analyzed: de gang zhe na yungs kar gyi 'bru phra mo'i tshad tsam gyi thig le'i gzugs te /
translated: What is that? It is the form of a drop the size of a small mustard seed.

original: 'di ltar srog la sogs pa'i rlung lnga dang / nye bar rgyu ba la sogs pa'i rlung lnga bde ba chen po'i dbang gis byang chub kyi sems kyi thig ler gyur pa rnams gsang ba'i snar 'dod chags kyi rigs can gyi sems la ltos nas srog dang rtsol ba'i rim gyis steng dang 'og tu spro ba dang
analyzed: 'di ltar srog la sogs pa'i rlung lnga dang / nye bar rgyu ba la sogs pa'i rlung lnga bde ba chen po'i dbang gis byang chub kyi sems kyi thig ler gyur pa rnams gsang ba'i snar 'dod chags kyi rigs can gyi sems la ltos nas srog dang rtsol ba'i rim gyis steng dang 'og tu spro ba dang
translated: Thus, the five winds such as life and the five winds such as the up-moving are by the power of great bliss transformed into the bindu of bodhicitta.

original: bsdu bas brtan par byed pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags kyi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa'i thig le'i rnal 'byor te dang po'o //
analyzed: bsdu bas brtan par byed pa'i bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags kyi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa'i thig le'i rnal 'byor te dang po'o //
translated: Those are the meditation of the yoga of the bindu of the practitioner of the desire type, who stabilizes them by the process of prƒÅ·πáa and ƒÅyƒÅma through the upper and lower nostrils in dependence on the mind of the desire type.

original: de kho na bzhin du zhe sdang gi rigs can gyi sems can la ltos nas snying ga'i padma'i lte bar thugs rdo rje'i sa bon gyi thig le la gsung gi sa bon dang sku'i sa bon gyis rim gyis them par bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du zhe sdang gi rigs can gyi sems can la ltos nas snying ga'i padma'i lte bar thugs rdo rje'i sa bon gyi thig le la gsung gi sa bon dang sku'i sa bon gyis rim gyis them par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, in dependence on the sentient beings of the anger type, the seed of the mind of enlightenment is placed in the bindu of the seed of mind at the center of the heart lotus by the process of the seed of speech and the seed of body.

original: de nyid du rlung gi dkyil 'khor ma lus pa bkag nas spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim gyis gzung ba ni zhe sdang gi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa'i thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //üîΩyang de bzhin du dkyil 'khor bzhi'i rim pa bzhin du 'od zer gyi 'khor lo dmar po la sogs pa spros nas g-yas dang g-yon dang gnyi ga dang / dal bar rgyu ba'i bye brag gis sna'i rtse mor thun phyed kyi bar du thig le gzung ba ni gti mug gi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa'i thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de nyid du rlung gi dkyil 'khor ma lus pa bkag nas spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim gyis gzung ba ni zhe sdang gi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa'i thig le'i rnal 'byor ro // yang de bzhin du dkyil 'khor bzhi'i rim pa bzhin du 'od zer gyi 'khor lo dmar po la sogs pa spros nas g-yas dang g-yon dang gnyi ga dang / dal bar rgyu ba'i bye brag gis sna'i rtse mor thun phyed kyi bar du thig le gzung ba ni gti mug gi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa'i thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The yogic exercise of the drop for the yogin of the type of hatred is the retention of the drop by the process of emission and re-absorption, having blocked all the ma·πá·∏çalas of wind in that very place.üîΩThe yogic exercise of the drop for the yogin of the type of delusion is the retention of the drop at the tip of the nose for half a period, by the distinctions of moving to the right, moving to the left, and moving slowly, having emitted the circle of red light-rays and so forth in the sequence of the four ma·πá·∏çalas.üîΩThe yogic exercise of the drop for the yogin of the type of pride is the retention of the drop at the tip of the nose for half a period, having emitted the circle of yellow light-rays and so forth in the sequence of the four ma·πá·∏çalas.üîΩThe yogic exercise of the drop for the yogin of the type of envy is the retention of the drop at the tip of the nose for half a period, having emitted the circle of green light-rays and so forth in the sequence of the four ma·πá·∏çalas.

original: de bzhin du smin ma'i dbus dang lte ba'i dbus dag tu rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod par grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du smin ma'i dbus dang lte ba'i dbus dag tu rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod par grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i yang shes par bya'o //
translated: The yogic exercise of the drop for the yogin of the type of stupidity is the retention of the drop at the tip of the nose for half a period, having emitted the circle of white light-rays and so forth in the sequence of the four ma·πá·∏çalas.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu byas nas rlung gi de kho na nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu byas nas rlung gi de kho na nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Having made all of them one, it is called the reality of wind.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i thabs dang po yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i thabs dang po yin no //
translated: The first method is the stage of vajra repetition.

original: sngags kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni gnyis pa yin zhing de yang yi ge gsum ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni gnyis pa yin zhing de yang yi ge gsum ste /
translated: The second is called the reality of mantra, which is the three syllables.

original: aom a'a:h'um ngo //
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um ngo //
translated: They are Om, Ah, and Hum.

original: 'di ltar khams gsum pa 'di dag thams cad sgra med na tha snyad dang bral ba'i phyir long ba dang lkugs pa lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khams gsum pa 'di dag thams cad sgra med na tha snyad dang bral ba'i phyir long ba dang lkugs pa lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if this entire threefold world were without sound, it would be like the blind and the mute, because it would be devoid of conventional usage.üîΩIf there were no sound called

original: gal te sgra zhes bya ba'i 'od //
analyzed: gal te sgra zhes bya ba'i 'od //
translated: light,

original: 'khor ba'i bar du gsal mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i bar du gsal mi 'gyur //
translated: samsara would not be illuminated.

original: ma lus srid pa gsum po 'di //üîΩmun pa @28a * //
analyzed: ma lus srid pa gsum po 'di // mun pa @28a * //
translated: This entire threefold world

original: stug po bzhin du 'gyur //
analyzed: stug po bzhin du 'gyur //
translated: would be like thick darkness.

original: sngon gyi rgyal po snyan pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal po snyan pa'i gzugs //
translated: The former kings, who were the forms of fame,

original: tshig gi rang bzhin me long thob //
analyzed: tshig gi rang bzhin me long thob //
translated: obtained the mirror of the nature of words.

original: de dag nye bar mi gnas kyang //
analyzed: de dag nye bar mi gnas kyang //
translated: Even though they are no longer present,

original: rang nyid nyams pa med la ltos //
analyzed: rang nyid nyams pa med la ltos //
translated: look at how they are not destroyed themselves.

original: de'i phyir spyod lam thams cad kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo ni sgra kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyod lam thams cad kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo ni sgra kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, sound alone is the primary cause of engagement in all activities.

original: sgra de yang yi ge phyi mo bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i rang bzhin can gyi bcom ldan 'das ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra de yang yi ge phyi mo bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i rang bzhin can gyi bcom ldan 'das ma yin no //
translated: And that sound is not the Blessed Lady, who is the nature of the forty-nine phonemes.

original: de yang lte ba'i gnas na srog ces bya ba'i rlung gis bskul nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: de yang lte ba'i gnas na srog ces bya ba'i rlung gis bskul nas 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, it arises from the navel region, impelled by the wind called ‚Äúlife-force.‚ÄùüîΩThe sound that arises from the body,

original: nam mkha'i rlung las rab byung lus las ni //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rlung las rab byung lus las ni //
translated: which is born from the wind of space,

original: 'byung zhing kha ru nye bar phyin pa'i sgra //üîΩgnas gzhan dag tu rab tu phye ba na //
analyzed: 'byung zhing kha ru nye bar phyin pa'i sgra // gnas gzhan dag tu rab tu phye ba na //
translated: is the sound that reaches the mouth,

original: yi ge nyid 'gyur gang yin de'i sgra'o //
analyzed: yi ge nyid 'gyur gang yin de'i sgra'o //
translated: which is the sound of the phonemes that arise in other places.

original: de ni mi 'gyur tshangs pa mchog dang gtsang //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gyur tshangs pa mchog dang gtsang //
translated: That sound is unchanging, pure, and supreme,

original: phug na gnas par bram ze yang dag 'dod //
analyzed: phug na gnas par bram ze yang dag 'dod //
translated: and the Brahmins who live in the forest desire it.üîΩBy applying it, one attains the highest good,

original: de rab sbyor bas nges pa legs pa dang / mngon par mtho bas skyes bus sbyor bar byed //
analyzed: de rab sbyor bas nges pa legs pa dang / mngon par mtho bas skyes bus sbyor bar byed //
translated: and by the higher knowledge, one attains the goal of human life.

original: ces gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ces gang bshad pa'o //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de lta bu'i yi ge'i phyi mo bcom ldam 'das ma zla ba dang nyi ma'i rang bzhin can 'od g-yas dang g-yon nas rgyu ba dang / gnas brgyad du thugs nas dbyangs dang gsal bya'i dbye bas 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yi ge'i phyi mo bcom ldam 'das ma zla ba dang nyi ma'i rang bzhin can 'od g-yas dang g-yon nas rgyu ba dang / gnas brgyad du thugs nas dbyangs dang gsal bya'i dbye bas 'byung ste /
translated: She arises from the heart in the eight places, divided into vowels and consonants.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: yi ge rnams kyi gnas brgyad de //
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi gnas brgyad de //
translated: The eight places of the lettersüîΩare the chest, throat, head,

original: brang dang lkog ma mgo bo dang // lce yi rtsa ba so dang ni //
analyzed: brang dang lkog ma mgo bo dang // lce yi rtsa ba so dang ni //

original: sna dang rkan dang mchu'i gnyis so //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sna dang rkan dang mchu'i gnyis so // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the nose, palate, and the two lips.

original: 'di ltar yang gnas brgyad las byung ba'i sde tshan brgyad ni rnam par shes pa brgyad po'i rang bzhin dang / rigs kyi yum bzhi dang / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi'i rang bzhin yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang gnas brgyad las byung ba'i sde tshan brgyad ni rnam par shes pa brgyad po'i rang bzhin dang / rigs kyi yum bzhi dang / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi'i rang bzhin yin zhing /
translated: Thus, the eight groups arising from the eight places have the nature of the eight consciousnesses, and the four classes of letters have the nature of the four mothers such as Buddhalocana, and the four such as Vairocana.

original: yi ge ksha ni mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: yi ge ksha ni mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The letter k·π£a has the nature of Akshobhya.

analyzed: sde tshan brgyad po de rnams kyang yi ge aa la sogs pa dang po'i yi ge brgyad kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: These eight classes are also included in the eight initial letters, a, etc.

original: de dag kyang bsdu na khams bzhi'i rang bzhin can gyi aa dang ka dang ya dang sha dang bzhis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang bsdu na khams bzhi'i rang bzhin can gyi aa dang ka dang ya dang sha dang bzhis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: They are also included in the four, a, ka, ya, and ≈õa, which have the nature of the four elements.

original: de rnams kyang gsum du 'dus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang gsum du 'dus par 'gyur te /
translated: They are also included in three.

original: aa dang ka dang ya'o //
analyzed: aa dang ka dang ya'o //
translated: a, ka, and ya.

original: de la yi ge aa la sogs pa'i sde tshan ni bud med kyi rang bzhin te shes rab po //
analyzed: de la yi ge aa la sogs pa'i sde tshan ni bud med kyi rang bzhin te shes rab po //
translated: The class of letters beginning with a is of the nature of a woman, that is, wisdom.

original: yi ge ka la sogs pa'i yi ge ma'i mthar thug pa'i sde tshan ni skyes pa'i rang bzhin te thabs so //
analyzed: yi ge ka la sogs pa'i yi ge ma'i mthar thug pa'i sde tshan ni skyes pa'i rang bzhin te thabs so //
translated: The class of letters beginning with ka and ending with ma is of the nature of a man, that is, method.

original: ya la sogs pa'i yi ge ha'i mthar thug pa'i sde tshan ni ma ning gi rang bzhin te gnyis po 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: ya la sogs pa'i yi ge ha'i mthar thug pa'i sde tshan ni ma ning gi rang bzhin te gnyis po 'dus pa'o //
translated: The class of letters beginning with ya and ending with ha is of the nature of a neuter, that is, the union of the two.

original: de nas @28b 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas @28b 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Now, here this should be investigated:

original: bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is a woman, what is a man, and what is a neuter?

original: de la kha cig ni /
analyzed: de la kha cig ni /
translated: In this regard, some say:

original: nu ma skrar ldan bud med yin /
analyzed: nu ma skrar ldan bud med yin /
translated: A woman is one who has breasts and hair.

original: kha sbur ldan pa skyes bur brjod //üîΩde dag med pa gnyis po'i bar //
analyzed: kha sbur ldan pa skyes bur brjod // de dag med pa gnyis po'i bar //
translated: A man is one who has a beard and moustache.

original: gang yin pa ni ma ning ngo //
analyzed: gang yin pa ni ma ning ngo //
translated: One who is devoid of both is a eunuch.

original: zhes zer ba de ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes zer ba de ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: gal te nu ma dang skra dang ldan pa nyid mo'i rtags yin na /
analyzed: gal te nu ma dang skra dang ldan pa nyid mo'i rtags yin na /
translated: If having breasts and hair is the mark of a woman,

original: de'i tshe khri dang phreng ba la sogs pa rnams mo nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe khri dang phreng ba la sogs pa rnams mo nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then a throne, a garland, etc., would be women,

original: de rnams la de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams la de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have breasts and hair.

original: skra bregs pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir sa yang bud med nyid du 'gyur te de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: skra bregs pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir sa yang bud med nyid du 'gyur te de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: The earth would be a woman because it has hair and breasts, but that is unacceptable.

original: bcos pa'i skra dang nu ma dang ldan pa'i cha byad 'dzin pa'i gar mkhan yang mo nyid du yin par thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bcos pa'i skra dang nu ma dang ldan pa'i cha byad 'dzin pa'i gar mkhan yang mo nyid du yin par thal bar 'gyur /
translated: It follows that an actor who takes on the appearance of a woman, having breasts and hair that are artificial, would be a woman.

original: kha spu dang ldan pa skyes pa nyid yin na ni ri sgog la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra ba'i phyir skyes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha spu dang ldan pa skyes pa nyid yin na ni ri sgog la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra ba'i phyir skyes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If having a beard and moustache is the mark of a man, then a cucumber and so on would be men, because they have beards and moustaches.

original: gnyis po spangs pa ma ning nyid yin na yang ma ning nyid du thal bar 'gyur na mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gnyis po spangs pa ma ning nyid yin na yang ma ning nyid du thal bar 'gyur na mi 'dod de /
translated: If the third sex were the absence of both, then it would follow that the third sex would be a eunuch, but that is unacceptable.

original: de ni mo'i rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mo'i rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a eunuch is a male.

original: de bas na phyogs 'di ni legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phyogs 'di ni legs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this position is not good.

original: kha cig ni chung ba dang che ba dang bar ma dag pho dang mo dang ma ning zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni chung ba dang che ba dang bar ma dag pho dang mo dang ma ning zhes bya ste /
translated: Some say: The small, large, and medium are called female, male, and neuter.

original: de la chung ba ni stobs chung ba'o //
analyzed: de la chung ba ni stobs chung ba'o //
translated: Among them, the small is weak.

original: de la che ba ni stobs che ba'o //
analyzed: de la che ba ni stobs che ba'o //
translated: Among them, the large is strong.

original: stobs 'bring dang ldan pa ni bar ma ste /
analyzed: stobs 'bring dang ldan pa ni bar ma ste /

original: de dag go rims bzhin du rtags gsum gyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes zer ba de yang bden pa ma yin pa ste /üîΩgal te de lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: de dag go rims bzhin du rtags gsum gyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes zer ba de yang bden pa ma yin pa ste / gal te de lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin par gyur na /

original: de'i tshe bu mo gzhon nu ma'i skye bar gyur la de'i stobs skyes pa na pha nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bu mo gzhon nu ma'i skye bar gyur la de'i stobs skyes pa na pha nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, then when a young girl becomes a man, her strength would increase and she would become a father.

original: 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de bzhin du rgud par gyur pa'i skyes bu rgas par gyur pa'i stobs zad pa ni bud med nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgud par gyur pa'i skyes bu rgas par gyur pa'i stobs zad pa ni bud med nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, a person who is weak from old age, who has lost his strength, becomes a woman.

original: de ni bud med nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni bud med nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: But this is not accepted.üîΩAlso, a man or woman who possesses medium strength becomes a eunuch.

original: stobs 'bring dang ldan pa'i skyes pa 'am bud med nyid kyang ma ning nyid du 'gyur bas mtshan nyid 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stobs 'bring dang ldan pa'i skyes pa 'am bud med nyid kyang ma ning nyid du 'gyur bas mtshan nyid 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This definition is not correct.

original: kha cig ni skad phra ba la sogs pa ni bud med kyi rtags yin la /üîΩskad sbom pa la sogs pa ni pho'i rtags yin zhing de gnyis ka spangs pa ni ma ning nyid kyi rtags yin no zhes zer na de yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni skad phra ba la sogs pa ni bud med kyi rtags yin la / skad sbom pa la sogs pa ni pho'i rtags yin zhing de gnyis ka spangs pa ni ma ning nyid kyi rtags yin no zhes zer na de yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: Some say: The characteristics of a woman are a soft voice and so on,üîΩthe characteristics of a man are a loud voice and so forth, and the characteristics of a eunuch are the absence of both.

original: skyes bu mdze can gang yin pa de dag skad phra bar 'gyur bas de dag kyang bud med nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu mdze can gang yin pa de dag skad phra bar 'gyur bas de dag kyang bud med nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But this is not accepted because a man who has leprosy has a soft voice and so on, and it would then follow that he would become a woman.

original: de bzhin du bud @29a * //üîΩmed gzhan skad sbom pa gang yin pa de dag skyes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bud @29a * //üîΩmed gzhan skad sbom pa gang yin pa de dag skyes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //

original: skad bar ma dang ldan pa ma ning nyid yin na /
analyzed: skad bar ma dang ldan pa ma ning nyid yin na /
translated: If a neuter has the intermediate sex organs,

original: rgyud mangs la sogs pa ma ning nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyud mangs la sogs pa ma ning nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: he is a neuter with the intermediate sex organs.

original: rgyud mangs la sogs pa ni rtags gsum char yin pa'i phyir mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyud mangs la sogs pa ni rtags gsum char yin pa'i phyir mi 'dod do //
translated: But this is unacceptable, because the intermediate sex organs are a sign of all three sexes.

original: sbrum ma dang bu btsa' ba bud med kyi rtags yin no zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbrum ma dang bu btsa' ba bud med kyi rtags yin no zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also unreasonable to say that the signs of a woman are the breasts and the womb,

original: bud med mo gsham gang yin pa de skyes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med mo gsham gang yin pa de skyes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because a barren woman would not be a woman.

original: kha spu dang ldan pa skyes pa nyid kyi rtags yin no zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: kha spu dang ldan pa skyes pa nyid kyi rtags yin no zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa yin te /

analyzed: bod kyi rigs kha cig la kha spu med pas de'i phyir de dag bud med nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because some Tibetan men have no facial hair, and therefore would not be men.

original: gnas pa la sogs pa gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kha spu dang bcas pa'i phyir skyes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kha spu dang bcas pa'i phyir skyes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And the yoginis who are the practitioners of the yoga of the body, etc., would be men, because they have facial hair.

original: de bas na bud med la sogs pa'i rtags kyi mtshan ma nyid la nges pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na bud med la sogs pa'i rtags kyi mtshan ma nyid la nges pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no certainty in the signs of a woman, etc.

original: kha cig ni rtags la khyad par med de /
analyzed: kha cig ni rtags la khyad par med de /
translated: Some say: There is no difference in the signs because the signs are based on the world.

original: rtags ni 'jig rten la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de yang rigs pa ma yin te gal te 'jig rten la brten pa nyid yin par khas len pa de'i tshe ci ste rtags so sor nges pa yin te /
analyzed: rtags ni 'jig rten la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de yang rigs pa ma yin te gal te 'jig rten la brten pa nyid yin par khas len pa de'i tshe ci ste rtags so sor nges pa yin te /
translated: That is illogical, because if you accept that they are based on the world, then why are the signs ascertained individually?

original: chu ngogs dang khang pa la sogs pa'i sgra dag rtags gsum char nyid yin pa bzhin du ci'i phyir 'dres par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: chu ngogs dang khang pa la sogs pa'i sgra dag rtags gsum char nyid yin pa bzhin du ci'i phyir 'dres par mi 'gyur /
translated: Why don‚Äôt the sounds of the bank of a river, a house and so on become mixed, just as they are the three signs?

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid 'di thams cad ni 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid 'di thams cad ni 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Therefore all these definitions are mistaken.

original: de bas na 'dir rang gi grub pa'i mtha' 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir rang gi grub pa'i mtha' 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore here we will state our own tenets.

original: khyab par byed pa dang / khyab par bya ba dang / de gnyi ga'i rang bzhin can dag ni pho dang mo dang ma ning gi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa dang / khyab par bya ba dang / de gnyi ga'i rang bzhin can dag ni pho dang mo dang ma ning gi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The pervader, the pervaded and that which has the nature of both are the natures of male, female and neuter.

original: de bzhin du yang lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi sems kyi rgyud khyab par byed pa'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dngos po thams cad la khyab par byed pa'i shes rab ni mo'i rtags nyid du tha snyad gdags so //üîΩlhan cig skyes pa de yi khyab par bya ba'i chos can nam /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi sems kyi rgyud khyab par byed pa'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dngos po thams cad la khyab par byed pa'i shes rab ni mo'i rtags nyid du tha snyad gdags so // lhan cig skyes pa de yi khyab par bya ba'i chos can nam /
translated: Likewise, the wisdom that pervades all things by the nature of the reality that pervades the mind-stream with the nature of innate bliss is designated as the female gender.

original: skyes bu gang yin pa'i khyab par bya ba de ni skyes bu zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gang yin pa'i khyab par bya ba de ni skyes bu zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The pervaded phenomenon, the person, who is pervaded by that innate [wisdom] is to be called a person.

original: 'di ni chos can dang chos nyid kyi tha snyad kyis sems can gyi 'jig rten la pho dang mo'i rtags kyi bye brag bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos can dang chos nyid kyi tha snyad kyis sems can gyi 'jig rten la pho dang mo'i rtags kyi bye brag bzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the presentation of the distinction of male and female genders in the world of sentient beings by the conventions of phenomenon and reality.

original: de gnyis ka spangs pa'i bems po'i rnam pa can gyi snod kyi 'jig rten ni ma ning gi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ka spangs pa'i bems po'i rnam pa can gyi snod kyi 'jig rten ni ma ning gi ngo bo yin no //
translated: The inanimate world, which has the aspect of matter that abandons both of those [genders], is the nature of the neuter.

original: dngos po bems po rnams kyi mo dang pho'i @29b sgra'i tha snyad gang yin pa de ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi bag chags kyi dbang du byas pa'i rnam par rtog pa can gyi rnam par shes pas byas pa yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin
analyzed: dngos po bems po rnams kyi mo dang pho'i @29b sgra'i tha snyad gang yin pa de ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi bag chags kyi dbang du byas pa'i rnam par rtog pa can gyi rnam par shes pas byas pa yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin
translated: The conventions of female and male for inanimate things are made by conceptual consciousnesses that are under the influence of beginningless habitual tendencies, but they are not ultimate.

original: no // de ltar na shes rab dang thabs dang de gnyi ga spangs pa dag ni mo dang pho dang ma ning dag yin no //
analyzed: no // de ltar na shes rab dang thabs dang de gnyi ga spangs pa dag ni mo dang pho dang ma ning dag yin no //
translated: Thus, wisdom, method, and their abandonment are female, male, and neuter.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dang po'i yi ges bsdus pa'i dbyangs kyi sde tshan bcu drug pa'i ngo bo ni bud med kyi rang bzhin gyis yi ge a'i nang du 'dus pa yin te khyab par byed pa yin pa'i
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dang po'i yi ges bsdus pa'i dbyangs kyi sde tshan bcu drug pa'i ngo bo ni bud med kyi rang bzhin gyis yi ge a'i nang du 'dus pa yin te khyab par byed pa yin pa'i
translated: Therefore, the nature of the first letter, which is included in the perfection of wisdom, is the nature of the sixteenth vowel class, which is included within the female letter a, because it is the pervader.

original: phyir ro // gsal bya'i sde tshan ni khyab par bya ba nyid dang thabs kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir pho nyid yin te /
analyzed: phyir ro // gsal bya'i sde tshan ni khyab par bya ba nyid dang thabs kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir pho nyid yin te /
translated: The class of consonants is the pervaded, and because it is the nature of method, it is male.

original: de nyid dbyangs med par brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dbyangs med par brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it cannot be expressed without vowels.

original: de bas na yi ge h'um ni de dag sdud par byed pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yi ge h'um ni de dag sdud par byed pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, the letter hum is the essence of their collection.

original: ya la sogs pa'i sde tshan thabs dang shes rab 'dus pas bskyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag gis sdud par byed pa ni yi ge aom yin no //
analyzed: ya la sogs pa'i sde tshan thabs dang shes rab 'dus pas bskyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag gis sdud par byed pa ni yi ge aom yin no //
translated: The letter om is the collection of those, because the classes beginning with ya are generated by the union of means and insight.

original: 'di ltar de la tshad phyed dang gsum yod de aa dang au dang ma'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la tshad phyed dang gsum yod de aa dang au dang ma'o //
translated: Thus, it has three and a half measures: a, u, and m.

original: de la yi ge aa ni shes rab kyi cha'o //
analyzed: de la yi ge aa ni shes rab kyi cha'o //
translated: Therein, the letter a is the portion of insight.

original: yi ge ma ni thabs kyi cha'o //
analyzed: yi ge ma ni thabs kyi cha'o //
translated: The letter m is the portion of means.

original: de gnyis 'brel par byed pa'i bdag nyid ni yi ge au ste de'i phyir yon tan byas nas aom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis 'brel par byed pa'i bdag nyid ni yi ge au ste de'i phyir yon tan byas nas aom du 'gyur ro //
translated: The identity of their union is the letter u. Therefore, having made the quality, it becomes om.

original: yi ge gsum po de dag ni sku gsung thugs dang / khams gsum dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gsum dang / rtsa gsum dang / sku gsum dang / rtags gsum dang / 'jig rten gsum dang / khams gsum gyi rang bzhin yin zhing 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can yin par shes par bya ste de lta bu ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge gsum po de dag ni sku gsung thugs dang / khams gsum dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gsum dang / rtsa gsum dang / sku gsum dang / rtags gsum dang / 'jig rten gsum dang / khams gsum gyi rang bzhin yin zhing 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can yin par shes par bya ste de lta bu ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid ces bya'o //
translated: One should understand that those three syllables are the nature of the body, speech, and mind, the three realms, the three thus-gone ones, the three channels, the three bodies, the three signs, the three worlds, and the three realms, and they are the nature of entering, abiding, and arising.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos mos pa sna tshogs pa can gyi sems can gyi khams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang khams dang bag chags kyi dbye bas sngags dbye ba stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis gsungs pa de dag thams
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos mos pa sna tshogs pa can gyi sems can gyi khams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang khams dang bag chags kyi dbye bas sngags dbye ba stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis gsungs pa de dag thams
translated: Thus, the BhagavƒÅn MahƒÅvajradhara taught the seventy-two thousand divisions of mantra according to the inclinations, latent tendencies, and dispositions of the realms of sentient beings.

original: cad kyi rtsa ba ni dbyangs dang gsal bya'i bdag nyid can gyi yi ge phyi mo yin zhing /
analyzed: cad kyi rtsa ba ni dbyangs dang gsal bya'i bdag nyid can gyi yi ge phyi mo yin zhing /
translated: All of those are rooted in the vowels and consonants, which are the nature of the letters.

original: de yang sngar bshad pa'i rim pas yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid can kho na yin pas de'i phyir sngags kyi de kho na nyid ni yi ge gsum po kho na yin par brjod par bya'o //üîΩde yang 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rlung gsum du 'dus pas rgyu las 'bras bu nye bar @30a * //
analyzed: de yang sngar bshad pa'i rim pas yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid can kho na yin pas de'i phyir sngags kyi de kho na nyid ni yi ge gsum po kho na yin par brjod par bya'o // de yang 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rlung gsum du 'dus pas rgyu las 'bras bu nye bar @30a * //
