analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa yin te /
translated: The essence of mirror-like wisdom is the stage of vajra repetition.

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pa spangs pa'i ma ning gi bzlas pa thob pa na rnal 'byor pas gzugs brnyan bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pa spangs pa'i ma ning gi bzlas pa thob pa na rnal 'byor pas gzugs brnyan bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the yogin attains the neuter repetition which is free from the stages of entry and so on, he sees the gnosis of the ultimate realm as a reflection.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The stage of the pure mind is the nature of the gnosis of equality,

original: der sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo rnams dang / ye shes dang / rnam par shes pa rnams dang / rang bzhin rnams 'od gsal bar mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo rnams dang / ye shes dang / rnam par shes pa rnams dang / rang bzhin rnams 'od gsal bar mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there the natures of mind and mental functions, the consciousnesses and the natures, attain equality in clear light.

original: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni /
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni /
translated: The stage of self-consecration

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: is the nature of the gnosis of individual investigation,

original: de la sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten la sgyu ma lta bu nyid du so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten la sgyu ma lta bu nyid du so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there one individually investigates the world of sentient beings and the inanimate world as being like an illusion.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ni bya ba nan tan bsgrub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ni bya ba nan tan bsgrub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The stage of manifest enlightenment is the nature of the gnosis accomplishing the acts,üîΩbecause there one manifests the body of the deity.

original: de kho na nyid la zhugs pas 'bad pa med pa kho nar sems can gyi don ma lus par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la zhugs pas 'bad pa med pa kho nar sems can gyi don ma lus par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, by entering into reality, all the aims of sentient beings are accomplished without effort.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi @37a * //üîΩngo bo yin te /
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi @37a * // ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of union is the essence of the pristine wisdom of the extremely pure realm of reality,

original: dri ma med cing mtha' yas pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'i ye shes 'ba' zhig de la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med cing mtha' yas pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'i ye shes 'ba' zhig de la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because only that pristine wisdom, which is like stainless, infinite space, appears there.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ni sa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ni sa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of vajra repetition is the essence of the earth,

original: rnam par rtog pa rags pa rnams rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rags pa rnams rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because coarse discursive thoughts are pacified.

original: chu rnam par dag pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ste ;
analyzed: chu rnam par dag pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ste ;
translated: The stage of the pure mind is the purification of water,

original: ye shes dang / rnam par shes pa dang / rang bzhin rnams 'gags nas sems chu'i rgyun gyi tshul du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes dang / rnam par shes pa dang / rang bzhin rnams 'gags nas sems chu'i rgyun gyi tshul du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because after the cessation of pristine wisdom, consciousness, and the natural outflows, the mind flows like a stream of water.

original: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni me rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni me rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The stage of self-consecration is the essence of the purification of fire,üîΩbecause the mind of enlightenment, which is like fire, is generated.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mes dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsreg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mes dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsreg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The stage of illusion-like concentration is the fire that burns the conceptual thoughts of the objective world.

original: rlung rnam par dag pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: rlung rnam par dag pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The stage of purification of the winds is the stage of manifest enlightenment,

original: 'od gsal ba las 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags bar ma la sogs pa rnams rtsva bzhin du khyer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba las 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags bar ma la sogs pa rnams rtsva bzhin du khyer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it carries away desire, freedom from desire, and the middle way of desire, etc., like a flood carries away grass.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ni nam mkha' rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ni nam mkha' rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of union is the essence of the purification of space,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes ni nam mkha'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes ni nam mkha'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the intuition of the Dharma realm is the essence of space.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of vajra repetition is the essence of the consecration initiation,

original: kun gzhi la sogs pa rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur bas rgyud rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi la sogs pa rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur bas rgyud rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the transformation of the consciousnesses of the ground of all, etc., is the purification of the stream of consciousness.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur ba'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur ba'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of the purification of mind is the essence of the irreversible consecration initiation,üîΩbecause it is the purification of the stream of mind.

original: sems rnam par dag pa thob pa na slar mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa thob pa na slar mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the mind has attained complete purity, it does not return.

original: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of self-consecration is the essence of the secret consecration,

original: ye shes kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body of gnosis is attained.

original: dus de nas brtsams de ni rtog pa med //
analyzed: dus de nas brtsams de ni rtog pa med //
translated: From that time on, he is without thought.

original: bya ba byas shing tshogs bsags de las ni //üîΩde yi dbyibs dang sku mdog phyag mtshan ni //
analyzed: bya ba byas shing tshogs bsags de las ni // de yi dbyibs dang sku mdog phyag mtshan ni //
translated: Having done what was to be done, having accumulated the stores,üîΩhe should think of the body as he wishes, of inconceivable form,

original: 'dod bzhin bsam mi khyab pa'i sku bsam bya //
analyzed: 'dod bzhin bsam mi khyab pa'i sku bsam bya //
translated: of shape and color and hand implements.

original: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ni shes rab kyi dbang bskur ba'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ni shes rab kyi dbang bskur ba'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of manifest enlightenment is the essence of the wisdom consecration,

original: de ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi shes rab kyi rim pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi shes rab kyi rim pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is attained by the stage of wisdom, which has the nature of the outer and inner.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang gi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang gi ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of union is the essence of the wisdom-gnosis consecration,üîΩbecause it is attained by the stage of wisdom-gnosis, which has the nature of the outer and inner.

original: de ni 'bras bur gyur pa dang dus phyis bya ba med pa dang mi slob nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bur gyur pa dang dus phyis bya ba med pa dang mi slob nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the result, because there is no activity after that, and because it is the state of no learning.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo yin te /
translated: Vajra repetition is the essence of Vairochana,

original: des snga ma bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes @37b thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des snga ma bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes @37b thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by it one attains the mirror-like pristine awareness as before.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of mind purification is the essence of Ratnasambhava,

original: de thob pas ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ram nga rgyal gyi rtsa ba can gyi ye shes dang / rnam par shes pa dang rang bzhin gyi tshogs 'od gsal bar thim pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thob pas ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ram nga rgyal gyi rtsa ba can gyi ye shes dang / rnam par shes pa dang rang bzhin gyi tshogs 'od gsal bar thim pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by attaining it all wishes are fulfilled by the sky-treasury samadhi, or because the pristine awareness which has pride as its root and the aggregate of consciousness dissolve into the clear light.

original: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of self-consecration is the essence of Amitabha,

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dngos po thams cad la yang dag par dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dngos po thams cad la yang dag par dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by the illusion-like samadhi one analyzes all things correctly.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ni mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ni mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of manifest enlightenment is by nature Ak·π£hobhya,

original: de kho na nyid bzhi pa dang chos kyi dbyings la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bzhi pa dang chos kyi dbyings la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between the fourth reality and the expanse of reality.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ni don yod grub pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ni don yod grub pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of union is by nature Amoghasiddhi,

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa'i bya ba ma lus pa sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa'i bya ba ma lus pa sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it accomplishes all the activities of ripening and liberating the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ni sbyor ba'i lam gyi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ni sbyor ba'i lam gyi ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of vajra repetition is by nature the path of preparation,

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag sngags kyi don la rnam par dpyod pa na de bzhin du gyur par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag sngags kyi don la rnam par dpyod pa na de bzhin du gyur par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one analyzes the meaning of the mantra, one sees that it is the same as the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, which are by nature the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of mind isolation is by nature the path of seeing,üîΩbecause it is the first direct perception of the truth of the ultimate.

original: snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes re re zhing rjes su shes pa la thug pa'i bar skad cig bco lngar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes re re zhing rjes su shes pa la thug pa'i bar skad cig bco lngar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each of the pristine wisdoms, such as the appearance, and so on, are seen for fifteen moments, up to the subsequent knowledge.

original: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of self-consecration is the essence of the path of cultivation,

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin can gyi skad cig gcig tu mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin can gyi skad cig gcig tu mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is directly realized in a single moment, which has the nature of the meditative stabilization that is like an illusion.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ni khyad par gyi lam gyi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ni khyad par gyi lam gyi ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of manifest enlightenment is the essence of the path of distinction,

original: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the essence of the uninterrupted path and the path of liberation.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ni mi slob pa'i lam gyi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ni mi slob pa'i lam gyi ngo bo yin te /
translated: The stage of union is the essence of the path of no learning,

original: nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pas de las gong na bya ba med pa'i phyir dang bslab par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pas de las gong na bya ba med pa'i phyir dang bslab par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the essence of the wisdom of penetration, and because there is nothing higher to do and nothing higher to train in.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga'i ngo bo ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga'i ngo bo ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nature of the five consciousnesses is as follows:

original: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dag ni don gyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dag ni don gyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The forms, etc., which are the nature of the world of sentient beings and the world of their habitat, are the consciousness of objects.

original: de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa yin te /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa yin te /
translated: The nature of their purification is the stage of vajra repetition,

original: de rags pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzlog pa'i @38a * //
analyzed: de rags pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzlog pa'i @38a * //
translated: because it stops the gross discursive thought.

original: phyir ro // bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i dbang po rnams ni sems can yin zhing de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa yin te /
analyzed: phyir ro // bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i dbang po rnams ni sems can yin zhing de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa yin te /
translated: The faculties belonging to one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô continua are sentient beings. The nature of their purification is the stage of the purification of mind,

original: dbang po thams cad kyi bdag nyid can rang bzhin gyi chogs zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad kyi bdag nyid can rang bzhin gyi chogs zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exhausts the natural instinct for all the faculties.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi ying ni bdag gi rnam par shes pa yin zhing de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi ying ni bdag gi rnam par shes pa yin zhing de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The afflicted mind is one‚Äôs own consciousness. The nature of its purification is the stage of self-consecration,üîΩbecause it stops the instinct for the afflicted mind.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa rnams 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa rnams 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The illusion-like meditative stabilization is for the sake of refuting the view of self, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag ni rnam par rig pa'i rnam par shes pa yin zhing de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag ni rnam par rig pa'i rnam par shes pa yin zhing de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The eye consciousnesses, etc. are the consciousnesses of representation, and the essence of their purification is the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'gog par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'gog par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it is the very thing that stops the active consciousnesses.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa yin zhing de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni zung du 'jug pa'i ngo bo ste bag chags dang bcas shing nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa yin zhing de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni zung du 'jug pa'i ngo bo ste bag chags dang bcas shing nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fundamental consciousness is the conditional consciousness, and the essence of its purification is the essence of union, because it destroys all the seeds of the afflictions together with their instincts.

original: 'phags pa byams pas /üîΩdon dang sems can bdag rnams rig / snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pas / don dang sems can bdag rnams rig / snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni //
translated: The noble Maitreya says,üîΩThe consciousness of appearance

original: rab tu skye bo de don med //
analyzed: rab tu skye bo de don med //
translated: arises for the sake of objects, sentient beings, and the self.

original: de med pas na de yang med //
analyzed: de med pas na de yang med //
translated: When those are nonexistent, it does not arise.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes //
translated: one is the condition of consciousness.

original: gnyis pa nye bar spyod pa can //
analyzed: gnyis pa nye bar spyod pa can //
translated: The second is the enjoyer.

original: nye bar spyod yongs spyod dang // de yi 'jug byed sems las byung //
analyzed: nye bar spyod yongs spyod dang // de yi 'jug byed sems las byung //
translated: The enjoyer is the enjoyment, and the engagement in that is the mental factor.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du gti mug dang zhe sdang dang nga rgyal dang 'dod chags dang phrag dog rnam par dag pa ni rim pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gti mug dang zhe sdang dang nga rgyal dang 'dod chags dang phrag dog rnam par dag pa ni rim pa lnga pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the purification of delusion, hatred, pride, attachment, and jealousy is the five stages.

original: de la gti mug rnam par dag pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: de la gti mug rnam par dag pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste /
translated: Therein, the vajra recitation is the purification of delusion,

original: sngags la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi gti mug rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngags la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi gti mug rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it purifies the delusion of those who are attached to mantras.

original: zhe sdang rnam par dag pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ste thams cad nye bar sdud par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang rnam par dag pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ste thams cad nye bar sdud par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The stage of the purification of mind is the purification of hatred, because it is the means of gathering everything.

original: nga rgyal rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The stage of the purification of pride is the stage of self-consecration,üîΩbecause it is the means of attaining the body of the deity.

original: tha mal pa'i nga rgyal rnam par sbyangs nas ye shes kyi sku khyad par du 'phags pa'i nga rgyal 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i nga rgyal rnam par sbyangs nas ye shes kyi sku khyad par du 'phags pa'i nga rgyal 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The stage of the creation of the deity is the essence of the purification of pride, because it is the essence of the purification of ordinary pride and the assumption of the pride of the exalted body of pristine awareness.

original: de'i phyir zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa sna tshogs pa dang ldan zhing rim pa thams cad kyi 'bras bur gyur pa yin pas khyad par gsal ba yod pa kho na'o //

original: de kho na nyid thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang gi tshe ldang bar byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar de 'bras bu zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin nam ;
analyzed: de kho na nyid thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang gi tshe ldang bar byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar de 'bras bu zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin nam ;

analyzed: 'on te mi ldang na ni de'i tshe rim pa gnyis kyi don gcig pa yin pas bye brag med pa'i phyir de dag la khyad par ci yod ce na brjod par bya ste /

original: rim pa bzhi pa gcig tu mtshungs pa nyid yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang rnal 'byor pa ldang ba zhes bya ba de kho na nyid la gnas bzhin du sems can gyi don byed pa ste /

original: bdag cag gi rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa spyod pa byed do zhes de ltar mthong gi / de ni de kho na nyid de las nyams pa ni med de /
analyzed: bdag cag gi rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa spyod pa byed do zhes de ltar mthong gi / de ni de kho na nyid de las nyams pa ni med de /
translated: We see that the yogi engages in conduct because he has conceptual thoughts, but he does not fall from reality.

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is always equipoised.

original: 'di ltar gnas pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of abidance.

original: ston pa'i gnas pa dang / spyod lam gyi gnas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas pa dang / nang du yang dag 'jog la gnas pa'o //

translated: The Buddha's abiding is fourfold: abiding in the performance of action, abiding in the performance of conduct, abiding in the performance of samadhi, and abiding in the performance of internal equipoise.

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku'i phrin las gang yin pa de ni spyod lam gyi gnas pa'o //
translated: The Buddha's performance of physical action is his abiding in the performance of conduct.

original: gsung gi phrin las gang yin pa de ni ston pa'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gi phrin las gang yin pa de ni ston pa'i gnas pa'o //
translated: The Buddha's performance of verbal action is his abiding in the performance of teaching.

original: thugs kyi phrin las gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas pa'o //
translated: The Buddha's performance of mental action is his abiding in the performance of samadhi.üîΩThe Buddha's performance of mental action for the sake of approaching gods and so on is his abiding in the performance of internal equipoise.

original: lha la sogs pa nye bar 'gro bar bya ba'i ched kyi thugs kyi phrin las gang yin pa de ni nang du yang dag 'jog la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bzhengs pa dang bzhugs pa dang gzims pa dang 'chag pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: lha la sogs pa nye bar 'gro bar bya ba'i ched kyi thugs kyi phrin las gang yin pa de ni nang du yang dag 'jog la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bzhengs pa dang bzhugs pa dang gzims pa dang 'chag pa'i mtshan nyid
translated: The Bhagavan Buddha is characterized by rising, sitting, lying down and walking.

original: kyi spyod lam thams cad du mnyam par gzhag pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa yang de dang 'dra ba kho na yin pas 'gal ba med do //üîΩsngon bzung ba'i snying rje dang / smon lam dag @41a * //
analyzed: kyi spyod lam thams cad du mnyam par gzhag pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa yang de dang 'dra ba kho na yin pas 'gal ba med do // sngon bzung ba'i snying rje dang / smon lam dag @41a * //
translated: Just as the potter's wheel, once set in motion, continues to revolve without further effort, so also the yogi who has attained the stage of union, by the power of his previous practice of compassion and aspirational prayers, engages in the activities of teaching and ripening sentient beings without any effort.

original: las sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir de rnams kyi bstan pa dang smin par bya ba la sogs pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo bzhin du 'bad pa med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: las sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir de rnams kyi bstan pa dang smin par bya ba la sogs pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo bzhin du 'bad pa med par 'jug ste /
translated: The activities of teaching and ripening sentient beings are performed effortlessly, like the potter's wheel.

original: rdza mkhan gyi lag pa'i bya ba bshol zhing de'i 'bras bu bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thob tu zin kyang sngar 'dus byas pa'i dbang gis 'khor lo 'khor ba nyid do //

translated: Even though the potter's hands stop their activity, the wheel continues to revolve and produce the characteristics of pots and so on by the power of its previous momentum.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa zad cing de kho na nyid thob tu zin kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus sgyu mas sprul pa'i skyes bu bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa zad cing de kho na nyid thob tu zin kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus sgyu mas sprul pa'i skyes bu bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa mdzad de /
translated: Likewise, even though the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience are exhausted and reality is attained, like a person emanated by a magician, one performs the various deeds of a buddha through the power of previous aspirations.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,üîΩMay the fuel of the view of the perishable composite, which produces all faults, be burned,

original: nyes pa thams cad skyed byed 'jig tshogs lta bu'i bud shing dag ni bsregs gyur cig / bdag gzhan bye brag yul rnams drungs phyung gang yin de la nyes pa 'byung ba min //

original: nyes pa med kyang blo bzang sgyu ma'i mi ni rig sngags lta bu'i snying rje dang // sngon gyi smon lam dbang gis 'khor lo'i rnam pa bzhin du las la skul bar byed //
analyzed: nyes pa med kyang blo bzang sgyu ma'i mi ni rig sngags lta bu'i snying rje dang // sngon gyi smon lam dbang gis 'khor lo'i rnam pa bzhin du las la skul bar byed //

original: ces bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ces bshad pa'o //
translated: This is explained.

original: de nas 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste /

analyzed: rim pa lnga pa bsgom pa 'dir ni rnal 'byor pa lnga'i dbang du byas sam /
translated: In this meditation on the five stages, is it done from the perspective of the five yogas,

original: 'on te gcig gi yin /
analyzed: 'on te gcig gi yin /
translated: Or, is it of one?

original: 'di ltar rim pa re re zhing 'od gsal ba'i 'bras bu bshad pas don byas zin pa yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa lnga yin pa'i dgos pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rim pa re re zhing 'od gsal ba'i 'bras bu bshad pas don byas zin pa yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa lnga yin pa'i dgos pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, since the result of clear light is explained in each stage, the purpose is that there are only five yogas, since the meaning is already accomplished.

analyzed: 'on te gcig yin na de'i tshe rim pa gcig gis de kho na nyid thob pa'i phyir rim pa gzhan gyi dgos pa ci yod ce na /

analyzed: 'dir ni rnal 'byor pa gcig kho na'i dbang du byas pa'o zhes brjod par bya ste /

original: 'di ltar ngag dang sems dang lus dang kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag par byed pa'am rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lnga pa'i gnas skabs na shin tu rdzogs par 'gyur gyi gcig la ni ma yin no //

translated: Thus, in the state of the five stages of vajra repetition and so on, which purify speech, mind, body, conventional and ultimate truth, it is fully complete, but not in one.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rim pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: For that very reason, the term stage is meaningful.

analyzed: rim pa phyi ma phyi mas khyad par du 'phags pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the later and later stages attain the superior state.

analyzed: gzhan du na lcags kyi dbyig pa lta bu ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'am gzhan yang rung gcig bu la rim pa nyid ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /

analyzed: 'on te rang gi rigs la ltos nas de'i rig pa nyid brjod pa yin na ni /
translated: But if it is said that the knowledge of that stage is expressed in terms of its own kind,

analyzed: de'i tshe rim pa ma yin la dbye ba @41b brjod par bya ste /
translated: then at that time it is not a stage, and the division should be expressed.

original: ji skad du rdo rje bzlas pa sku'i bzlas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu gcig yin pa de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du rdo rje bzlas pa sku'i bzlas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu gcig yin pa de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: As it was previously explained, ‚ÄúJust as vajra repetition is elevenfold by the division of body repetition and so on, so are the others.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa gcig kho na rim gyis rim gyis goms par byed pas na rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa mngon du byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa gcig kho na rim gyis rim gyis goms par byed pas na rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa mngon du byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since a single yogi gradually cultivates, he will actualize the attainment of the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud le'u bco brgyad pa'i brjod par bya ba'i bsgom pa lhur len pa'i sgrub pa po'i gcig yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud le'u bco brgyad pa'i brjod par bya ba'i bsgom pa lhur len pa'i sgrub pa po'i gcig yin pa bzhin no //
translated: as in the case of the practitioner who is intent on the meditation that is to be practiced by the single practitioner of the eighteen chapters of the Root Tantra.

original: de la ni le'u so so la sgom par byed pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ni le'u so so la sgom par byed pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, there is no meditation in each chapter,

original: gcig kho na'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig kho na'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is done in terms of the single practitioner.

original: sems can gyi khams ni rgyud sna tshogs pa'i phyir tsandan lta bu la sogs pa'i dbye bas gang zag gi dbye ba ni rigs shing de'i dbye bas bshad pa'i dbye ba ni rigs te /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ni rgyud sna tshogs pa'i phyir tsandan lta bu la sogs pa'i dbye bas gang zag gi dbye ba ni rigs shing de'i dbye bas bshad pa'i dbye ba ni rigs te /
translated: The realm of sentient beings is of various continuums, and the classification of persons is appropriate by the divisions of sandalwood and so forth. And the classification of the explanations by those divisions is appropriate,

original: rim pas thob par bya ba'i de kho na nyid kyi dbye ba ni rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rim pas thob par bya ba'i de kho na nyid kyi dbye ba ni rung ba ma yin no //
translated: but the classification of reality to be attained in stages is not appropriate.

original: yang rim pa re re zhing 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan to zhes gang smra ba de ni de kho na nyid kyi khyad par byed pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i don du yin gyi /

translated: Again, someone says that the reality of clear light is taught in each stage. That is because the reality of clear light is taught in order to teach the difference in reality.

original: mngon du bya ba ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa kho na yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mngon du bya ba ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa kho na yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: The stage of union is the only one that is to be realized, so there is no fault.

original: de rdzogs nas da ni rab tu byed pa rtsom pa'i rjod par byed pa la sogs pa rnams brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de rdzogs nas da ni rab tu byed pa rtsom pa'i rjod par byed pa la sogs pa rnams brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, having completed that, the author, etc., of the treatise should be stated.üîΩThus, it is said:

original: 'di ltar / bstan bcos dag ni thams cad dam //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bstan bcos dag ni thams cad dam //
translated: All treatises

original: bya ba cung zad 'ga' zhig la //
analyzed: bya ba cung zad 'ga' zhig la //
translated: Or even some small action

original: rjod byed med na 'jig rten dag / dmus long lkugs pa bzhin du 'gyur //
analyzed: rjod byed med na 'jig rten dag / dmus long lkugs pa bzhin du 'gyur //
translated: Without expression, the world would be like the blind and the mute.üîΩA treatise without anything to be expressed would be meaningless, like the cawing of a crow, etc.

original: zhes gang bshad pa'o //

translated: It is true that doubt arises first with regard to the words.

original: the tshom yang rnam pa gsum te /
analyzed: the tshom yang rnam pa gsum te /
translated: Doubt is also threefold:

original: don gyi the tshom dang / don ma yin pa'i the tshom dang / don dang don ma yin pa'i the tshom mo //
analyzed: don gyi the tshom dang / don ma yin pa'i the tshom dang / don dang don ma yin pa'i the tshom mo //
translated: doubt about the object, doubt about the non-object, and doubt about the object and the non-object.

original: de la don gyi the tshom ni dper na sa @43b 'og na yod pa'i gter rko ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la don gyi the tshom ni dper na sa @43b 'og na yod pa'i gter rko ba lta bu'o //
translated: Doubt about the object is, for example, like digging for a treasure that exists underground.

original: don ma yin pa'i the tshom ni chu klung drag po la lag pas rgal ba'o //
analyzed: don ma yin pa'i the tshom ni chu klung drag po la lag pas rgal ba'o //
translated: Doubt about the non-object is like crossing a strong river with one's arms.

original: don dang don ma yin pa'i the tshom ni dper na ro langs bsgrubs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: don dang don ma yin pa'i the tshom ni dper na ro langs bsgrubs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Doubt about the object and the non-object is, for example, like accomplishing a zombie.

original: de la don la the tshom za ba ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin no //
analyzed: de la don la the tshom za ba ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin no //
translated: Among those, doubting the object is a limb of engagement.

original: don ma yin pa la the tshom za ba ni ldog pa'i yan lag yin no //
analyzed: don ma yin pa la the tshom za ba ni ldog pa'i yan lag yin no //
translated: Doubting the non-object is a limb of disengagement.

original: don dang don ma yin pa la the tshom za ba yang ldog pa'i yan lag yin pas de'i phyir the tshom la 'jug par rigs pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: don dang don ma yin pa la the tshom za ba yang ldog pa'i yan lag yin pas de'i phyir the tshom la 'jug par rigs pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Since doubt about what is meaningful and what is not meaningful is also a limb of reversal, therefore it is not reasonable to engage in doubt.

original: de la dus phyis zhugs par gyur pa na thar pa'i lam bsgrubs nas de kho na nyid mngon sum du byed pas nyes pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de la dus phyis zhugs par gyur pa na thar pa'i lam bsgrubs nas de kho na nyid mngon sum du byed pas nyes pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: But if one later enters into it, then there is not the slightest fault, since one will accomplish the path of liberation and manifest the way things really are.

original: da ni gang zag dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gang zag dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the person should be analyzed.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di la dbang byed pa'i gang zag du zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di la dbang byed pa'i gang zag du zhe na /
translated: In this chapter, how many persons are there who are the masters of the self?üîΩThere are five.

original: lnga ste / lnga po de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga ste / lnga po de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those five?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: They should be stated.

original: rin po che lta bu dang / tsandan lta bu dang / padma lta bu dang / autpala lta bu dang / padma dkar po lta bu rnams so //
analyzed: rin po che lta bu dang / tsandan lta bu dang / padma lta bu dang / autpala lta bu dang / padma dkar po lta bu rnams so //
translated: They are the jewel-like person, the sandalwood-like person, the lotus-like person, the utpala-like person, and the white lotus-like person.

original: de la rmongs pa'i rigs can ni //üîΩtshandan lta bu'o// dbang po rtul po ni autpala lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la rmongs pa'i rigs can ni // tshandan lta bu'o// dbang po rtul po ni autpala lta bu'o //
translated: Among them, the one of dullest faculty is the jewel-like person.üîΩThe one of dull faculty is the sandalwood-like person.

original: dbang po 'bring po ni padma dkar po lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbang po 'bring po ni padma dkar po lta bu'o //
translated: The one of middling faculty is the white lotus-like person.

original: dbang po rnon po ni padma lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po ni padma lta bu'o //
translated: The sharp faculties are like the lotus.

original: dbang po rnon pa'i yang rnon po ni rin po che lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnon pa'i yang rnon po ni rin po che lta bu'o //
translated: The very sharp faculties are like the jewel.

original: de'i phyir gang zag bzhi ni tshogs kyi bshad pa'i snod yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag bzhi ni tshogs kyi bshad pa'i snod yin zhing /
translated: Thus, four persons are vessels for the teaching of the assembly.

original: gcig ni slob ma la bshad pa'i snod yin no //üîΩkha cig ni nyan pa po rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: gcig ni slob ma la bshad pa'i snod yin no // kha cig ni nyan pa po rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: One is a vessel for the teaching of the disciple.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Some say that there are four kinds of listeners:

original: mi shes pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / log par rtogs pa dang / nges pa'i blo can dag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / log par rtogs pa dang / nges pa'i blo can dag go zhes zer ro //
translated: the ignorant, the doubtful, the mistaken, and those of certain understanding.

original: mi shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Ignorance is of two kinds:

original: rdob lta bu'i blo can dang / shes par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rdob lta bu'i blo can dang / shes par 'dod pa'o //
translated: the dull-witted and those who desire to know.

original: de la rdob lta bu'i blo can ni don du mi gnyer ba ste yid ches par mi 'dod pas ni dor bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la rdob lta bu'i blo can ni don du mi gnyer ba ste yid ches par mi 'dod pas ni dor bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The dull-witted are not interested in the meaning and are not inclined to believe, so they are to be rejected.

original: shes par 'dod pa'i mi shes pa ni pha rol pos nye bar bstan pa la nyan pa gang yin pa ste de ni blang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa'i mi shes pa ni pha rol pos nye bar bstan pa la nyan pa gang yin pa ste de ni blang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: The ignorant who desire to know are those who listen to the teaching of others. They are to be accepted.

original: de'i rmongs pa'i dngos po ni bstan bcos kyi rim gyis ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rmongs pa'i dngos po ni bstan bcos kyi rim gyis ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The object of that delusion is eliminated by the treatise.

original: the tshom za ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Doubt is of two kinds:

original: don du gnyer ba dang don du mi gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba dang don du mi gnyer ba'o //
translated: that which is not sought and that which is sought.

original: de la don du mi gnyer ba'i the tshom za ba'i bdag nyid can ni thabs gang gis kyang gzung bar nus pa ma yin pas de ni dor bar bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la don du mi gnyer ba'i the tshom za ba'i bdag nyid can ni thabs gang gis kyang gzung bar nus pa ma yin pas de ni dor bar bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: The doubt that is not sought is not to be accepted by any means, so it is to be rejected.

original: don du gnyer ba'i the tshom za ba ni tshad ma nye bar dgod pa sngon du song bas the tshom bzlog ste /üîΩyang dag pa'i tshad ma dang @44a * //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba'i the tshom za ba ni tshad ma nye bar dgod pa sngon du song bas the tshom bzlog ste / yang dag pa'i tshad ma dang @44a * //
translated: The doubt that is sought is to be eliminated by the prior presentation of valid knowledge.üîΩThe treatise endowed with valid knowledge

original: ldan pa'i bstan bcos la rnam par dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: ldan pa'i bstan bcos la rnam par dgod par bya'o //
translated: is to be presented.

original: log par rtogs pa ni phyin ci log gi lta ba can yin la /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa ni phyin ci log gi lta ba can yin la /
translated: Misunderstanding is having a mistaken view.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is of three kinds:

original: mi shes pa dang / shes par 'dod pa dang / shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / shes par 'dod pa dang / shes pa'o //
translated: ignorance, the desire to know, and knowledge.

original: de la mi shes pa'i blo'i bye brag ma skyes pa'i rmongs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la mi shes pa'i blo'i bye brag ma skyes pa'i rmongs pa yin la /
translated: Among them, the ignorance that is a type of mind is delusion that has not arisen.

original: rigs pa dang lung dag gis yid ches par mi 'dod pa de ni rdo ba lta bu las bye brag med pas dor bar bya ba yin te /üîΩlas la chags pa'i mi shes pa'i //
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung dag gis yid ches par mi 'dod pa de ni rdo ba lta bu las bye brag med pas dor bar bya ba yin te / las la chags pa'i mi shes pa'i //
translated: He who does not wish to believe by means of reasoning and scripture is like a stone, and so is to be rejected.

original: blo yi bye brag bskyed bya min //üîΩzhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: blo yi bye brag bskyed bya min // zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: The wise man should not generate the various ideas of the ignorant man who is attached to action.

original: shes par 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: He who wishes to know is of two kinds:

original: the tshom za ba dang / de kho na nyid don du gnyer ba'o//
analyzed: the tshom za ba dang / de kho na nyid don du gnyer ba'o//
translated: he who is in doubt and he who seeks reality.

original: de la the tshom za ba gal te yid ches par mi byed na /
analyzed: de la the tshom za ba gal te yid ches par mi byed na /
translated: If he who is in doubt does not believe,

original: de lta na dor bar bya ba yin te /üîΩthe tshom bdag nyid nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta na dor bar bya ba yin te / the tshom bdag nyid nyams par 'gyur //
translated: he is to be rejected,

original: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: for it is said, Doubt destroys itself.

original: de kho na nyid 'dod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid 'dod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: He who seeks reality is of two kinds:

original: tshad ma dang mi ldan pa dang tshad ma dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang mi ldan pa dang tshad ma dang ldan pa'o //
translated: he who is not endowed with valid cognition and he who is endowed with valid cognition.

original: de la tshad ma dang mi ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshad ma dang mi ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is he who is not endowed with valid cognition?

original: gang zhig rigs pa la mi ltos par gzhan gyis nye bar bstan ba tsam las de kho na nyid khas len pa sta /
analyzed: gang zhig rigs pa la mi ltos par gzhan gyis nye bar bstan ba tsam las de kho na nyid khas len pa sta /
translated: He who accepts reality from the mere teaching of another without regard to reasoning.

original: 'on kyang yod par smra ba rnams kyi nang nas mchog tu gyur pa de ni brtsad pa'i gnas ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'on kyang yod par smra ba rnams kyi nang nas mchog tu gyur pa de ni brtsad pa'i gnas ma yin zhing /
translated: But the best of the realists is not the object of this refutation.

original: 'di ltar de'i the tshom ni myur du bsal bar nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i the tshom ni myur du bsal bar nus so //
translated: For his doubt can be quickly dispelled.

original: gal te tshad ma dang ldan pa yin na de ni gsum pa shes pa zhes bya bar bgrang ngo //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma dang ldan pa yin na de ni gsum pa shes pa zhes bya bar bgrang ngo //
translated: If he is endowed with valid knowledge, he is counted as a third, the knower.

original: re zhig de ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dang / zhi ba pa dang / grangs can pa dang / rigs pa ba dang / bye brag pa dang / mchod 'os pa dang / dpyod pa pa la sogs pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dang / zhi ba pa dang / grangs can pa dang / rigs pa ba dang / bye brag pa dang / mchod 'os pa dang / dpyod pa pa la sogs pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig yin no //
translated: He is one of the Lokayatas, the Shaivas, the Samkhyas, the Naiyayikas, the Vaisheshikas, the Aishvaras, the Mimamsakas, etc.

original: de las 'jig rten rgyang phan pa tshad ma dang ldan pa nyid kyis med par smra ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: de las 'jig rten rgyang phan pa tshad ma dang ldan pa nyid kyis med par smra ba kho na yin te /
translated: Among them, the Lokayata, because he is endowed with valid knowledge, is only a nihilist.

original: gang la mngon sum las ma gtogs par tshad ma gzhan med pa de ni sun dbyung bar bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la mngon sum las ma gtogs par tshad ma gzhan med pa de ni sun dbyung bar bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa yin no //
translated: He is the object of refutation, for whom there is no valid knowledge other than perception.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tshad ma mi 'dod cing 'jig rten pha rol med par sems pa thar pa las phyir phyogs pa'i rang gi nges pa'i rjes su 'brang ba na 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tshad ma mi 'dod cing 'jig rten pha rol med par sems pa thar pa las phyir phyogs pa'i rang gi nges pa'i rjes su 'brang ba na 'di skad du /
translated: Thus, those who do not assert valid knowledge such as inference and who think that a world beyond does not exist, who follow their own convictions that turn away from liberation, say:

original: rus pa thal ba bzhin song nas //üîΩslar 'tsho ba ni ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: rus pa thal ba bzhin song nas // slar 'tsho ba ni ga la 'gyur //
translated: When bones turn to dust,

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: how can they come back to life?

original: de skad du smra ba'i rgol ba de la shin tu mngon par brtson pa'i mkhas pa gzhan rnams kyis mngon par zhen pas gnod pa brjod @44b zin mod kyi /
analyzed: de skad du smra ba'i rgol ba de la shin tu mngon par brtson pa'i mkhas pa gzhan rnams kyis mngon par zhen pas gnod pa brjod @44b zin mod kyi /
translated: Other scholars who are very diligent in refuting that opponent have already expressed objections to that assertion.

original: 'on kyang bshad pa'i rim pa kho na bzhin du rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi sgo nas tshig cung zad cig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bshad pa'i rim pa kho na bzhin du rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi sgo nas tshig cung zad cig brjod par bya ste /
translated: Nevertheless, I will say a few words in some way, just as explained.

original: de bzhin du sngags dang rgyud dang bstan bcos la spyod pa'i yid can de ni chu gtsang ma shin tu dri ma med pa blangs nas nang par gdong bkru ba dang / zas za ba'i sngon dang phyis kyi dus su lag pa bkru ba la sogs pa'i cho ga byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags dang rgyud dang bstan bcos la spyod pa'i yid can de ni chu gtsang ma shin tu dri ma med pa blangs nas nang par gdong bkru ba dang / zas za ba'i sngon dang phyis kyi dus su lag pa bkru ba la sogs pa'i cho ga byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Likewise, those who are devoted to the mantra, tantra, and treatise, only perform the rite of washing their face in the morning and washing their hands before and after eating, having taken pure, very clean water.

original: ci ste gal te dri ma'i 'dam gyis nyes pa nye bar bsal ba'i phyir byed do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gal te dri ma'i 'dam gyis nyes pa nye bar bsal ba'i phyir byed do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that this is done in order to remove the fault of the dirt of impurity,

original: gdong dang lag pa'i dri ma mchil mas byugs pa dang skra la phyis pas bsal bar mi nus sam /
analyzed: gdong dang lag pa'i dri ma mchil mas byugs pa dang skra la phyis pas bsal bar mi nus sam /
translated: is it not possible to remove the dirt of the face and hands with saliva and to remove the dirt of the hair with a comb?

original: gal te de kho na bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de kho na bzhin yin zhe na /
translated: If it is just like that,

original: skye bo ma lus pa'i bzhad gad kyi rgyur gyur pa rigs pa ma yin pa'i bya ba byed pa skyes bu chen pos smad par gyur pa mi 'dod pa'i spyod pa'i dbang du gyur pa smod pa khyod las nges par dad par bya ba gzhan su zhig yod
analyzed: skye bo ma lus pa'i bzhad gad kyi rgyur gyur pa rigs pa ma yin pa'i bya ba byed pa skyes bu chen pos smad par gyur pa mi 'dod pa'i spyod pa'i dbang du gyur pa smod pa khyod las nges par dad par bya ba gzhan su zhig yod
translated: what other person is there to be trusted than you, who is the cause of laughter for all people, who performs unreasonable actions, who is despised by great beings, who is under the power of despised conduct?

original: / de nas gal te kho bos 'jig rten dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir gtsang sbra spyod do zhe na /
analyzed: / de nas gal te kho bos 'jig rten dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir gtsang sbra spyod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that you practice purity in order to conform with the world,

original: 'jig rten ni bstan bcos ba dang bstan bcos ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni bstan bcos ba dang bstan bcos ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: then the world is of two kinds: that which is in accord with the treatises and that which is not in accord with the treatises.

original: de la bstan bcos pa ni bstan bcos la 'jug cing /
analyzed: de la bstan bcos pa ni bstan bcos la 'jug cing /
translated: Those in accord with the treatises are those who engage with the treatises.

original: bstan bcos ma yin pa ni rjes su 'brang ba kho nar snang ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos ma yin pa ni rjes su 'brang ba kho nar snang ste /
translated: Those not in accord with the treatises are those who simply follow the treatises.

original: skyes bu chen po gang nas song de lam //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po gang nas song de lam //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere has the great man gone? What is his path?‚Äù

original: zhes gang smra ba'o //
analyzed: zhes gang smra ba'o //
translated: This is what they say.

original: de nas gal te yid bde ba skyed pa'i phyir de ltar 'bad pa byed do zhe na 'brel pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: de nas gal te yid bde ba skyed pa'i phyir de ltar 'bad pa byed do zhe na 'brel pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: If you say that you strive in this way in order to generate a sense of well-being, what is the connection?

original: gdong dang lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa dag la legs par byas pa ji ltar yid bde ba skyed par byed pa yin /
analyzed: gdong dang lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa dag la legs par byas pa ji ltar yid bde ba skyed par byed pa yin /
translated: How does washing your face, hands, and feet generate a sense of well-being?

original: de las gal te phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rgyu can gyi 'du ba lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa la nye bar gnas pa dang / sems 'phel ba'i khyad par ni rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de las gal te phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rgyu can gyi 'du ba lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa la nye bar gnas pa dang / sems 'phel ba'i khyad par ni rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that the special development of the mind is the cause of the contact that is based on the body faculty and so on, which is caused by external things,

original: 'o na 'di ni bzhad gad du mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na 'di ni bzhad gad du mi bya ste /
translated: then this is not a joke.

original: khyod ni kho bo'i grub pa'i mtha'i phyogs la brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod ni kho bo'i grub pa'i mtha'i phyogs la brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: You are accepting our philosophical position.

original: de nas gal te yid khas len na nyes par 'gyur ba zhig na kho bo cag la ni 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i yid ni med pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de nas gal te yid khas len na nyes par 'gyur ba zhig na kho bo cag la ni 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i yid ni med pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you accept the mind, then there is a fault. But we do not accept that the mind exists apart from the elements.

original: de lta na ni 'byung ba rnams bems po nyid yin pa'i phyir bum pa dang snam bu dag gcig la gcig bzhin tshor bar bya ba dang tshor ba po dang tshor ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'byung ba rnams bems po nyid yin pa'i phyir bum pa dang snam bu dag gcig la gcig bzhin tshor bar bya ba dang tshor ba po dang tshor ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, since the elements are insentient, a pot and a cloth would be like each other in being that which is to be felt and that which feels, and there would be no feeling.

original: 'on te lus kyi rang bzhin gyi 'byung ba rnams la tshor ba yod do zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'on te lus kyi rang bzhin gyi 'byung ba rnams la tshor ba yod do zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that the elements that are the nature of the body have feeling,

original: de lta na ni ming gzhan gyis yid khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni ming gzhan gyis yid khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: then you are accepting the mind under a different name.

original: 'on te kho bo ni lus kyi 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i rig pa @45a * //
analyzed: 'on te kho bo ni lus kyi 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i rig pa @45a * //
translated: But we do not assert that the self is a knower that is different from the body.üîΩ

original: khas mi len te /
analyzed: khas mi len te /
translated: But we do not accept a cognition that is not included among the body‚Äôs elements.

original: 'on kyang de dag rig pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag rig pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: However, they are the nature of cognition.üîΩBut in a dead body, since the collection is incomplete, the wind and fire elements are not present, and it is not like that.

original: shi ba'i lus la ni tshogs pa ma tshang ba'i phyir rlung dang me dag med par de lta bu ma yin no zhes zer na lus la yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du sems ni dbang pos 'di'o snyam du nyams su myong bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: shi ba'i lus la ni tshogs pa ma tshang ba'i phyir rlung dang me dag med par de lta bu ma yin no zhes zer na lus la yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du sems ni dbang pos 'di'o snyam du nyams su myong bar mi rung ngo //
translated: The mind is not suitable to be experienced by the sense faculty as ‚Äúthis‚Äù in the way that form and so on that exist in the body are.

original: de ni rang rig pas gzung ba yin no zhes brjod par yang mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni rang rig pas gzung ba yin no zhes brjod par yang mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be said that it is apprehended by reflexive awareness.

original: dngos po gcig ni tshad ma tha dad pas rig par bya ba nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gcig ni tshad ma tha dad pas rig par bya ba nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical for a single thing to be cognized by different valid knowledges.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po de dang de ni rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan byung nas 'jig pa can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po de dang de ni rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan byung nas 'jig pa can yin te /

original: khyab par byed pa rtag pa gcig pu'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhe na 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa rtag pa gcig pu'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhe na 'dir brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: re zhig dbang phyug ni byed pa po dang rtag pa yin par 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Here we say: First, it is not tenable that ƒ™≈õvara is a permanent agent.

analyzed: bye brag gang yin pa de kho na mi rtag pa nyid yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du yang gal te mi byed pa'i skad cig na de byed pa po yin na /

analyzed: byed pa'i tshe ni skyed par byed de nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bas na nus pa la ltos nas skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa yin te /

original: nus pa dang ldan pa ni nam mkha' bzhin gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa dang ldan pa ni nam mkha' bzhin gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'on te nus pa de las tha mi dad pas ltos pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te nus pa de las tha mi dad pas ltos pa med do zhe na /

original: 'o na sngar ci'i phyir skyed par byed pa kho nar ni ma yin /
analyzed: 'o na sngar ci'i phyir skyed par byed pa kho nar ni ma yin /
translated: Well then, why does it not produce an effect previously, when it is an agent?

original: byed pa'i nus pa la ltos nas skyed par byed pa nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: byed pa'i nus pa la ltos nas skyed par byed pa nyid du khas len na /

original: 'o na ni nus pa kho na skyed par byed pa @47a * //
analyzed: 'o na ni nus pa kho na skyed par byed pa @47a * //

original: yin te dbang phyug gis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: yin te dbang phyug gis ci zhig bya /

analyzed: gal te nus pa de de'i yin no zhe na /

analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung ba na rgyu 'gags par mthong ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ci ste nyes pa de bsal ba'i phyir 'du ba'i 'brel pa la brtan nas ni /
translated: If you maintain the relation of inherence in order to avoid that error,

analyzed: de'i tshe tha dad par snang ba med pa'i phyir nus pa dang dbang phyug dag las byed pa po gang yin zhes bya ba'i nges pa med do //

analyzed: gal te 'gebs pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dmigs so zhe na /

analyzed: 'o na de lta na ni rigs pas snal ma 'ga' zhig kho na khas blangs kyi ras yug ni ma yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa po dang rtag pa zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal ba yin no //

original: gal te de ni dbang phyug gi rang dbang nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ni dbang phyug gi rang dbang nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that is the independence of God,

translated: The NaiyƒÅyika and Vai≈õe·π£ika also rely on the doctrine of a permanent self, but they are not refuted.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: bdag la phung po la sogs pa yod par 'thad pa yang ma yin te /

original: de rnams la bdag yod do zhes bya ba yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de rnams la bdag yod do zhes bya ba yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not tenable to say that the self exists in those,

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kho na yin te /

original: phung po la ma gtogs pa yang mi dmigs te /

analyzed: gal te de ni me dang bud shing bzhin du tha mi dad ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not different from them, like fire and fuel,

analyzed: de lta na ni khyed shin tu mi rtag pa nyid yin par 'dod ba de bud shing rang gi ngo bo nyams nas sol ba'i rang bzhin nyid du gyur pa rnams ni me zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: then you would have to say that fire is fuel that has lost its original state and become the nature of ash.
